programme.title: The Children Act
W imię dziecka
The Children Act
programme.desc:
The Children Act: Directed by Richard Eyre. With Stanley Tucci, Emma Thompson, Jason Watkins, Ben Chaplin. As her marriage crumbles, a judge must decide a case involving a teenage boy who is refusing a blood transfusion on religious principle." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt6040662/","name":"The Children Act","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODUwOTk1MzI3NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNTI4NDE3NTM@._V1_.jpg","description":"As her marriage crumbles, a judge must decide a case involving a teenage boy who is refusing a blood transfusion on religious principle.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt6040662/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"bob-the-movie-man"},"dateCreated":"2018-08-26","inLanguage":"English","name":""And the Oscar goes to"... (or should go to)... "Dame Emma Thompson".","reviewBody":"Judge Maye (Thompson) is a childless wife to her loving husband Jack (Tucci), but is also a workaholic. This is driving the long-term couple to the point of infidelity: a fact the ever-focused Fiona - whose life, to her, probably feels to be in a perfect if selfish equilibrium - is oblivious to. With Fiona's intense but comfortable world about to cave in around her, her increasing stress is not helped by the latest case she is working on: one where Adam ( Fionn Whitehead from "Dunkirk"), a Jehovah's Witness boy and a minor, is refusing on religious grounds the blood transfusion he desperately needs to fight his lukaemia. Fiona's decisions in the months ahead go much further than a simple judgement on the case.

Two acting giants - one born in London; one born in New York - tower over this Ian McEwan adaptation like leviathons. I bandy around the phrase "national treasure" a lot in my reviews, but here Emma Thompson is simply breathtakingly powerful in the lead role of Judge Fiona Maye, exhibiting such extremes of emotion that you would like to think that an Oscar nomination would be assured. (However, before I run out and put a £10 bet on her to win, the film is such a small British film that unfortunately both a nomination and a win seem unlikely! THIS IS A CRIME! Please share and lobby people, lobby! Perhaps at the very least we can hope for some BAFTA recognition). 

Sometimes a masterly lead performance can make a co-star performance seem unbalanced, but no such danger here. Stanley Tucci makes a perfect acting foil for Thompson: if he were a wine he would be described as "exasperation, frustration, compassion with strong notes of respect". And he carries it off with perfection.

This is an incredibly intelligent film, working on so many different levels and subject to so much interpretation. Fiona's feelings for the troubled teenager feel more maternal than sexual, but when those feelings become returned and escalate the whole piece develops a queasily oedipal quality. Many films have focused on illicit attractions between teacher and pupil, but here lies a new variation, with Maye fighting against her best professional insticts to 'do the right thing'. "I'm frightened of myself" she eventually wails to a colleague. 

In his opening hospital scenes, (not withstanding the comic similarities between the guitar scene here and a certain scene in "Airplane"!), Adam seems completely other-wordly compared to a typical teen and this comes across as utterly false. That is, until you consider the oddness of his family background and Jehovah's Witness upbringing. As such, the film just about gets away with it. Whitehead does a good job with a difficult role. 

If you've been in a court, you'll know that there is something regal and magical about a judge in full regalia entering a packed courtroom. So it's unusual to see the view from the other side of the door... a non-descript office corridor and a non-descript door. Helping the judge on this side of the door is her PA Nigel, played by the brilliant Jason Watkins: a TV regular (e.g. "Line of Duty", "W1A") but seen far less at the movies. 

As a story of obsessive fixation, it borders on McEwan's disturbing earlier work "Enduring Love". And it has the potential to go in lots of interesting directions as a sort of bonkers platonic love triangle ("He wants to live with US?" splutters Tucci). Where the story does end up going was not particularly to my liking, and a melodramatic concert scene was - for me - a little overdone. However it does give rise to a scene (the 'sopping wet' scene) that shows Thompson at her most brilliant: if she DID get Oscar or BAFTA nominated then this will be her pre-announcement snippet.

It's a great film for showcasing acting talent, but beware: it's short on laughs, not remotely uplifting and takes a while to mentally recover from!","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":12172,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.7},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"2018-08-24","keywords":"female judge,husband wife relationship,teenage boy,teenager,17 year old","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2677390105","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOGIzYmNjOGItNWY1ZC00ZmI5LWFhMGMtZTI0OGMwYTczNmE5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOGIzYmNjOGItNWY1ZC00ZmI5LWFhMGMtZTI0OGMwYTczNmE5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"As her marriage to Jack (Stanley Tucci) flounders, eminent High Court judge Fiona Maye (Emma Thompson) has a life-changing decision to make at work - should she force a teenage boy, Adam (Fionn Whitehead), to have the blood transfusion that will save his life? Her unorthodox visit to his hospital bedside has a profound impact on them both, stirring strong new emotions in the boy and long-buried feelings in her."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001804/","name":"Stanley Tucci"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000668/","name":"Emma Thompson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0914327/","name":"Jason Watkins"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0264236/","name":"Richard Eyre"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0209419/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0103694/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0251858/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0568605/","name":"Ian McEwan"}],"duration":"PT1H45M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Transporter
Transporter
The Transporter
programme.desc:
The Transporter: Directed by Louis Leterrier, Corey Yuen. With Jason Statham, Shu Qi, François Berléand, Matt Schulze. Frank Martin, who "transports" packages for unknown clients, is asked to move a package that soon begins moving, and complications arise." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0293662/","name":"The Transporter","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTk2NDc2MDAxN15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTYwNDc1NDY2._V1_.jpg","description":"Frank Martin, who "transports" packages for unknown clients, is asked to move a package that soon begins moving, and complications arise.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0293662/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Captain_Couth"},"dateCreated":"2005-08-27","inLanguage":"English","name":"Jason Statham action star.","reviewBody":"The Transporter (2002) was a fun action film that was directed by Jet Li's fight director Corey Yuen and it starred Jason Statham. Jason stars as Frank Martin. He's a hired gin who does driving jobs for a hefty fee. For his services he'll use his superb driving skills to get his paying customers out of a jam. He asks no questions and needs precise instruction in order to perfectly time his getaways. His number one rule is to never ask questions. One day he takes a gig from a sleazy and shady man named Betancourt (Matt Schulze). Instead of delivering the goods, he breaks his number one rule and peeks inside the package...

A fun action film filled with bone breaking action and wild stunts. People have unfairly slammed this movie for being unrealistic. What do you expect? The action scenes are performed to flamboyant ans stylized you have to suspend belief. It's one of those movies that doesn't throw in realism all of a sudden to make the movie more interesting. Jason Statham is pretty cool as well as the Transporter and he seems legit, not another tough guy phony. HE looks like he can knock the tar out of you in a real fight. Co-stars Shu Qi (she learned to speak English phonetically for her role in this movie).

Highly recommended.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":292569,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Crime","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2002-12-11","keywords":"gunfight,premarital sex,mixed martial arts,tape over mouth,motor car","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Transporter","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3455779097","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BM2RjMjA2ZGQtMDJlMy00Mzk4LWJjNDYtNGJjMzczNzc3MGQwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BM2RjMjA2ZGQtMDJlMy00Mzk4LWJjNDYtNGJjMzczNzc3MGQwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Pre, "Coming Soon""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005458/","name":"Jason Statham"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0795517/","name":"Shu Qi"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0776580/","name":"Matt Schulze"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0504642/","name":"Louis Leterrier"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0477035/","name":"Corey Yuen"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0048273/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0079764/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0051228/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000108/","name":"Luc Besson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0436543/","name":"Robert Mark Kamen"}],"duration":"PT1H32M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: My Name Is Sara
Mam na imię Sara
My Name Is Sara
programme.desc: My Name Is Sara: Directed by Steven Oritt. With Zuzanna Surowy, Konrad Cichon, Pawel Królikowski, Piotr Nerlewski. Sara is a a 13 year-old Polish Jew who finds refuge and is taken in by a farmer and his wife. She soon discovers the dark secrets of her employers' marriage, compounding the greatest secret she must strive to protect, her true identity." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt6819310/","name":"My Name Is Sara","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZWU2ZjJhYmYtNGQxOS00MzYxLTlkYjctZWViYmFhYjE5Yzk3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNDQyNjQ0MDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Sara is a a 13 year-old Polish Jew who finds refuge and is taken in by a farmer and his wife. She soon discovers the dark secrets of her employers' marriage, compounding the greatest secret she must strive to protect, her true identi","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt6819310/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"sergius248"},"dateCreated":"2020-04-18","inLanguage":"English","name":"Survival story amongst pesants","reviewBody":"The film portrays the survival story of young Sara, portrayed with subtle intensity by Zuzanna Surowy. Amongst the horrors of the Nazi occupation, and the ferocious Jews persecution in the Ukraine the protagonist manages to escape pretending to be a gentile. The peasant she shelters with are not good or altruistic, they are just downtrodden people, fiercely attached to their land and traditions. While the cinematography and the direction is passable but not memorable and the story line somehow mundane, probably the better aspect of the production reside in the depiction of the local peasant society, of their perennial straggle against whatever power exploit them and their self-reliance. People that cannot afford to be generous or open-minded. There are only few acts of genuine altruism and many more of the opposite but the unsentimental and non-judgmental approach to the storytelling is refreshing, leaving the viewer to make up its mind on the grey morality of the real world.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":422,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.4},"genre":["Biography","Drama","History"],"datePublished":"2020-02-27","keywords":"world war two,jewish refugee,polish jew,13 year old girl,child protagonist","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm9160474/","name":"Zuzanna Surowy"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm9160475/","name":"Konrad Cichon"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0472028/","name":"Pawel Królikowski"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0649881/","name":"Steven Oritt"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0639858/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0282373/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0571591/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0385430/","name":"David Himmelstein"}],"duration":"PT1H51M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Trick
Trik
Trick
programme.desc:
Trick: Directed by Patrick Lussier. With Jamie Kennedy, Omar Epps, Vanessa Aspillaga, Tom Atkins. A no-nonsense detective tries to track down a mass murderer named Trick, who is terrorizing a small town." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt9177040/","name":"Trick","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BM2NhZDkwMzktNjIzNy00NTBjLWJhYzQtNDQyN2I0NzQ4NDVjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTEyMDE1MTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A no-nonsense detective tries to track down a mass murderer named Trick, who is terrorizing a small town.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt9177040/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"carolinephillips-47427"},"dateCreated":"2020-01-12","inLanguage":"English","name":"Acceptable Halloween Slice and Dicer","reviewBody":"Trick won't win any awards anytime soon, but it's far from the disaster many people have been making it out to be. I walked in expecting the worst, but the first 20 minutes genuinely gripped me and even made me jump once. As the film continues, it mostly becomes a Dr. Loomis vs. Michael Myers storyline with Omar Epps' frazzled detective trying to make sense of how a seemingly normal teenage male could survive a few gunshots and a fall off a hospital roof and still continue to kill people every Halloween for a number of years. Could it be a copycat killer? You'll have to stick with Trick to find out and, once you do, you'll most likely be let down.

While most of the film plays out like a supernatural-tinged slasher, the last 15 minutes of the movie, where the film finally reveals what's really been going on, is likely to inspire many groans and rolling eyes. There's a piece of an interesting idea in there, but it's not as well-executed as it could have been. There's a final twist at the end that's really a groaner and makes no sense whatsoever.

The acting is at least passable for most of the film and it's nice to see genre icon Tom Atkins getting something to do every now and then. It also might be one of the better of the recent "the corpses in this haunted house are real" movies that seem to be coming out all the time. There's some good suspense here and there, too, so Trick is far from a complete waste of time.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":4554,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.9},"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Horror"],"datePublished":"2019-10-18","keywords":"halloween,splatter,slasher,gore,bloody","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1954987801","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMGQ0NGJlMTctNGFmYy00OWI2LTk4YTYtZjBjYmY4ZWMzNmQ3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMGQ0NGJlMTctNGFmYy00OWI2LTk4YTYtZjBjYmY4ZWMzNmQ3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"On Halloween night in 2015, Patrick "Trick" Weaver massacred his classmates at a costume party. After being arrested, he managed to escape police custody, but not before being shot five times by Detective Mike Denver (Epps). Everyone believes Trick must be dead, but when a masked killer reappears the following Halloween, and every Halloween after that, they realize the nightmare is not over. With Trick wreaking havoc and killing innocent people in increasingly terrifying ways, Denver will stop at nothing to finish what he started and bring the carnage to an end."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005085/","name":"Jamie Kennedy"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004898/","name":"Omar Epps"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0039665/","name":"Vanessa Aspillaga"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0527261/","name":"Patrick Lussier"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0746728/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0766776/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0040970/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0267805/","name":"Todd Farmer"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0527261/","name":"Patrick Lussier"}],"duration":"PT1H40M"}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 9177040, Title: Trick, --- Description: Trick: Directed by Patrick Lussier. With Jamie Kennedy, Omar Epps, Vanessa Aspillaga, Tom Atkins. A no-nonsense detective tries to track down a mass murderer named Trick, who is terrorizing a small town." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt9177040/","name":"Trick","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BM2NhZDkwMzktNjIzNy00NTBjLWJhYzQtNDQyN2I0NzQ4NDVjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTEyMDE1MTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A no-nonsense detective tries to track down a mass murderer named Trick, who is terrorizing a small town.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt9177040/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"carolinephillips-47427","dateCreated":"2020-01-12","inLanguage":"English","name":"Acceptable Halloween Slice and Dicer","reviewBody":"Trick won't win any awards anytime soon, but it's far from the disaster many people have been making it out to be. I walked in expecting the worst, but the first 20 minutes genuinely gripped me and even made me jump once. As the film continues, it mostly becomes a Dr. Loomis vs. Michael Myers storyline with Omar Epps' frazzled detective trying to make sense of how a seemingly normal teenage male could survive a few gunshots and a fall off a hospital roof and still continue to kill people every Halloween for a number of years. Could it be a copycat killer? You'll have to stick with Trick to find out and, once you do, you'll most likely be let down.

While most of the film plays out like a supernatural-tinged slasher, the last 15 minutes of the movie, where the film finally reveals what's really been going on, is likely to inspire many groans and rolling eyes. There's a piece of an interesting idea in there, but it's not as well-executed as it could have been. There's a final twist at the end that's really a groaner and makes no sense whatsoever.

The acting is at least passable for most of the film and it's nice to see genre icon Tom Atkins getting something to do every now and then. It also might be one of the better of the recent "the corpses in this haunted house are real" movies that seem to be coming out all the time. There's some good suspense here and there, too, so Trick is far from a complete waste of time.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":4554,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.9,"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Horror"],"datePublished":"2019-10-18","keywords":"halloween,splatter,slasher,gore,bloody","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1954987801","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMGQ0NGJlMTctNGFmYy00OWI2LTk4YTYtZjBjYmY4ZWMzNmQ3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMGQ0NGJlMTctNGFmYy00OWI2LTk4YTYtZjBjYmY4ZWMzNmQ3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"On Halloween night in 2015, Patrick "Trick" Weaver massacred his classmates at a costume party. programme.title: Zloto dezerterów
Złoto dezerterów
programme.desc:
Zloto dezerterów: Directed by Janusz Majewski. With Marek Kondrat, Boguslaw Linda, Wiktor Zborowski, Katarzyna Figura. During World War II a group of safe-crackers sets off on a mission to steal gold from a Nazi bank." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0191666/","name":"Zloto dezerterów","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzM4OTI4ZGUtNmQyZS00NjZiLWE4OWUtNDA3Y2RkOGE4ZTkzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTc4MzI2NQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"During World War II a group of safe-crackers sets off on a mission to steal gold from a Nazi bank.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0191666/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Maziun"},"dateCreated":"2013-08-07","inLanguage":"English","name":"Bad sequel to fun movie","reviewBody":"This is a sequel to movie from 1985 – HK Deserters" . The heroes from the first movie also appear here , but there is plenty of new heroes . The first movie was a war comedy about a group of friends running away from army . This one is supposed to be a war comedy about stealing gold from Nazi's.

It was supposed to be comedy . Unfortunately the movie takes itself way too seriously . The movie unnecessary tries to tell something about anti-Semitism , betrayal and courage of freedom fighters. For more than half of the movie is hard to tell that this is comedy . When the so-called jokes appear in the second half of the movie they so awful you will groan. The movie also feels too long (it's 2 hours long ) , which wasn't a problem in the first movie (which was almost 3 hours long) . Gone is the charm and the fun of original.

The acting is good and the music is very jolly . Still , it's too little to save the movie from being a disaster. I give it 1/10. Better watch "Kelly's heroes". Or the original – "HK Deserters".","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":1}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":487,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5},"genre":["Action","Comedy","War"],"datePublished":"1998-12-04","keywords":"1940s,world war two","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0464945/","name":"Marek Kondrat"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0511277/","name":"Boguslaw Linda"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0953975/","name":"Wiktor Zborowski"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0538105/","name":"Janusz Majewski"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0538105/","name":"Janusz Majewski"}],"duration":"PT2H3M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: "Zasada przyjemności" - making of
programme.desc: W trakcie II wojny światowej z Polski zniknęły setki tysięcy bezcennych dzieł sztuki. Zarówno niemieccy, jak i radzieccy okupanci masowo wywozili obrazy i rzeźby. Nie wszystkie udało się odzyskać. Obecnie wiele z tych polskich zbiorów rozsianych jest po całym świecie. Historyk sztuki Jerzy S. Majewski przybliża losy tych zrabowanych dóbr. Snuje opowieść o skradzionym dorobku wielu wspaniałych artystów i wyjaśnia, co się z nim dokładnie stało.

programme.title: Wino truskawkowe
Wino truskawkowe
programme.desc: Wino truskawkowe: Directed by Dariusz Jablonski. With Jirí Machácek, Zuzana Fialová, Marian Dziedziel, Mieczyslaw Grabka. This is not a love story though it is full of love. It is not a comedy though the characters often say funny things. It is not a detective story even though the hero is trying to solve a murder. It is not a nature drama though it shows the splendid colours and customs of the countryside. It is not a musical though Lubica expresses her longing in a passionate dance. Nor is it a film about ghosts though a ghost does ask the hero for a favour. A few draughts of Strawberry Wine are enough to take us into a magical world in the true centre of Europe, where love, crime and penitence are just as much a part of life as the changing of the seasons, the migration of birds or the flowing of a mountain stream." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1260596/","name":"Wino truskawkowe","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTI5MjU4YjUtNGJkNy00Nzk2LTgyYWEtMDk0OTBmY2NmZTYyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTgyNDg0NTY@._V1_.jpg","description":"This is not a love story though it is full of love. programme.title: Jasminum
Jasminum
programme.desc: Jasminum: Directed by Jan Jakub Kolski. With Justyna Bartoszewicz, Grazyna Blecka-Kolska, Marta Dabrowska, Grzegorz Damiecki. The peaceful world of a monastery, in a small town Jasmine, is destroyed by the arrival of monument restorers, Natasha, along with her daughter Eugenia. The legend associated with the monastery bode revelation in him a saint in the near future. Despite initial reluctance, Natasha starts the maintenance of the image stored there. The secrets of the monastery are unraveled: the unhappy lovers bodies placed in the catacombs, the secret elixir of love, created with the smell of the monks." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0778749/","name":"Jasminum","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDkyNzM5ZmQtYTFmNi00ZGI3LWI2MjctNzYwMDAwOWM1ZTYyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTc4MzI2NQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"The peaceful world of a monastery, in a small town Jasmine, is destroyed by the arrival of monument restorers, Natasha, along with her daughter Eugenia. The legend associated with the monastery bode revelation in him a saint in the n","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0778749/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"voron-5"},"dateCreated":"2006-12-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"Excellent!","reviewBody":"Well....to be honest I am a huge fan of Masters Gayos and Peczka so their participation was the main force that made me to get JASMINUM and my God! the movie is AMAZING! From the beginning to the end...I was embraced by a cascade of colors, sounds and scents...yes - SCENTS for as one of previous reviewers said - You can literally FEEL the scent of the mysterious fragrances! I'd compare my impressions to those I got after watching "Amelie Poulain". Sound - amazing Picture - incredible Actors - superb! Without a doubt I can predict a bright future to Polish cinematography if there would be more that one of a kind (IMO - so far) movie I am talking about! \n\nIf you are looking for something different, if you are tired to the all like Hollywood "matrix" movies - JASMINUM is the very right answer!","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1273,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7},"genre":["Comedy","Romance"],"datePublished":"2006-05-05","keywords":"voice over narration,woman beater,sex,scent,runaway groom","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2702136/","name":"Justyna Bartoszewicz"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0088111/","name":"Grazyna Blecka-Kolska"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0196449/","name":"Marta Dabrowska"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0464383/","name":"Jan Jakub Kolski"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0004670/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0464383/","name":"Jan Jakub Kolski"}],"duration":"PT1H55M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Hollywood Buzz
programme.desc: W programie nowości kinowe, relacje z planów zdjęciowych oraz ciekawostki związanych z gwiazdami srebrnego ekranu. O pracy nad najnowszymi hollywoodzkimi produkcjami opowiadają ich twórcy - znani reżyserzy i aktorzy. Autorzy magazynu przedstawiają również zwiastuny filmów wchodzących na ekrany kin.

programme.title: Hollywood Buzz
programme.desc: W programie nowości kinowe, relacje z planów zdjęciowych oraz ciekawostki związanych z gwiazdami srebrnego ekranu. O pracy nad najnowszymi hollywoodzkimi produkcjami opowiadają ich twórcy - znani reżyserzy i aktorzy. Autorzy magazynu przedstawiają również zwiastuny filmów wchodzących na ekrany kin.

programme.title: Zatrzymanie
Detainment
programme.desc: Twórca obrazu powraca do wstrząsającej sprawy morderstwa na 2-letnim Jamesie Bulgerze, które w 1993 roku popełnili dwaj 10-latkowie. Scenariusz bazuje na autentycznych policyjnych nagraniach z przesłuchań sprawców.

credits.actor: Ely Solan
Leon Hughes
Will O'Connell
David Ryan
Tara Breathnach
Morgan C. Jones
Brian Fortune
Kathy Monahan
Killian Sheridan

programme.title: Quel joli temps pour jouer ses vingt ans
Lato już było
Remont w 48h
programme.desc: Tomasz Pągowski odwiedza ludzi, którzy chcieliby zrobić w swoim mieszkaniu remont, ale boją się kosztów i utrudnień. Architekt udowodni im, że metamorfozę można przeprowadzić szybko, tanio i bezproblemowo.

programme.title: Remont w 48h
programme.desc: Tomasz Pągowski odwiedza ludzi, którzy chcieliby zrobić w swoim mieszkaniu remont, ale boją się kosztów i utrudnień. Architekt udowodni im, że metamorfozę można przeprowadzić szybko, tanio i bezproblemowo.

programme.title: Lifting wnętrz z Marią Semczyszyn
programme.desc: Maria Semczyszyn wraz ze swym kompanem, Wieśkiem, pomaga w błyskawicznym re-designie pokojów, których obecny wygląd z różnych powodów nie zadowala właścicieli. Zadanie nie należy do łatwych - to właściciele decydują, w jakim stylu mają być urządzone pomieszczenia. Dekoratorka musi sprostać ich oczekiwaniom, niejednokrotnie przedstawiając projekty, które kłócą się z jej własnym gustem.

programme.title: News+
programme.desc: Podsumowanie najważniejszych wydarzeń z aren sportowych. Omówienie sukcesów, rekordów i porażek. Program prowadzą zamiennie m.in. Piotr Karpiński, Piotr Salak, Wojciech Zawioła i Gabriel Rogaczewski.

programme.title: Piłka nożna: Liga hiszpańska - podsumowanie sezonu 2020/2021
Zielona rewolucja Marty Dymek 2
programme.desc: Marta Dymek przeprowadza w kuchni rewolucję. Przekonuje mięsożerców do potraw wegańskich. Wśród jej gości znajdą się złoty medalista z Pekinu Piotr Małachowski i kucharki z baru mlecznego.

programme.title: ABC gotowania - kuchnia włoska
programme.desc: Sztuka kulinarna we Włoszech opiera się na prostych potrawach przygotowanych z dobrych składników. Oliwa z oliwek, warzywa i zioła, sery, ryby, owoce morza, jajka, mąka i oliwki to podstawy wielu dań.

programme.title: Jakubiak rodzinnie
programme.desc: Gotowanie jest znakomitym pretekstem do spędzania czasu z rodziną. Znany szef kuchni Tomasz Jakubiak zachęca do dzielenia się z bliskimi pysznymi daniami. Sam w programie przedstawi członków swojej rodziny: mamę, tatę, siostrę oraz narzeczoną. Wraz z nimi w każdym odcinku zaprezentuje proste pomysły na śniadanie, obiad i kolację. Nie zabraknie anegdot z życia kucharza oraz cennych wskazówek kulinarnych.

programme.title: Meblokreacje 5
programme.desc: Artur Indyka podejmuje się ciekawych wyzwań. Przedstawia świeże pomysły na stare meble i dodatki do wnętrz. Pozornie bezużyteczne przedmioty zyskują drugie życie i nowe funkcje. Ekspert zajmuje się m.in. starymi skrzyniami wojskowymi, z których powstaje designerski regał pod RTV czy dziecięcym łóżkiem, przerobionym na serwantkę. Nie brakuje też rozwiązań w duchu "zero waste", takich jak wykorzystanie plastikowych słomek jako tworzywa do ramy lustra.

programme.title: Meblokreacje 5
programme.desc: Artur Indyka podejmuje się ciekawych wyzwań. Przedstawia świeże pomysły na stare meble i dodatki do wnętrz. Pozornie bezużyteczne przedmioty zyskują drugie życie i nowe funkcje. Ekspert zajmuje się m.in. starymi skrzyniami wojskowymi, z których powstaje designerski regał pod RTV czy dziecięcym łóżkiem, przerobionym na serwantkę. Nie brakuje też rozwiązań w duchu "zero waste", takich jak wykorzystanie plastikowych słomek jako tworzywa do ramy lustra.

programme.title: Pogotowie remontowe Wieśka 4
programme.desc: Wiesiek Skiba pomaga ludziom, którzy stali się ofiarami nierzetelnych firm remontowych. Specjalista naprawi rozmaite usterki zgłoszone przez widzów. Udowodni też, że wiele drobnych remontów w kuchni, łazience, salonie czy na tarasie można zrobić samodzielnie.

programme.title: Historia największych przebojów
programme.desc: Dziesięcioodcinkowy serial dokumentalny, który przybliża okoliczności, jakie towarzyszyły powstawaniu najsłynniejszych utworów wielkich artystów muzyki popularnej. Wśród nich znajdują się Madonna, Sting, Rod Steward czy Cher.

programme.title: News+
programme.desc: Podsumowanie najważniejszych wydarzeń z aren sportowych. Omówienie sukcesów, rekordów i porażek. Program prowadzą zamiennie m.in. Piotr Karpiński, Piotr Salak, Wojciech Zawioła i Gabriel Rogaczewski.

programme.title: Acid Rain
programme.desc: Młoda ucieka z domu. Podróżuje autostopem. Poznaje niezrównoważonego dziwaka Chudego. Pod osłoną nocy snują się po mieście, docierają w coraz dziwniejsze rejony, doświadczając niezwykłych emocji.

credits.actor: Daria Polasik

programme.title: Myszy i szczury
programme.desc: Dramatyczne losy małego Adasia (Miłosz Kwiecień), którego przykre doświadczenia sprzed lat odbijają się na psychice całej rodziny. Wzruszająca historia o bezgranicznej miłości, przeznaczeniu, poczuciu winy i ponoszeniu konsekwencji za swoje czyny.

programme.title: THE LEGENDS z Tomkiem Ćwiąkałą
programme.desc: Cykl wywiadów przeprowadzanych przez Tomka Ćwiąkałę z ważnymi postaciami ze świata futbolu. Wśród nich są mistrzowie świata, Europy i gwiazdy topowych lig. Widzowie dowiedzą się, czym zajmują się dzisiaj, jak wspominają swoje kariery oraz poznają ich plany na przyszłość.

programme.title: Wielka szpera
programme.desc: Wrzesień 1942 roku, getto w Łodzi. Niemcy ogłaszają zakaz opuszczania domów i organizują wywózkę ponad 15 tysięcy żydowskich dzieci oraz starców do obozu zagłady w Chełmnie. Te wstrząsające wydarzenia przeszły do historii pod nazwą "Wielkiej szpery". Przed kamerą mówią o niej ludzie, którzy przeżyli tamte tragiczne dni.

programme.title: Jasminum
Jasminum
programme.desc: Jasminum: Directed by Jan Jakub Kolski. With Justyna Bartoszewicz, Grazyna Blecka-Kolska, Marta Dabrowska, Grzegorz Damiecki. The peaceful world of a monastery, in a small town Jasmine, is destroyed by the arrival of monument restorers, Natasha, along with her daughter Eugenia. The legend associated with the monastery bode revelation in him a saint in the near future. Despite initial reluctance, Natasha starts the maintenance of the image stored there. The secrets of the monastery are unraveled: the unhappy lovers bodies placed in the catacombs, the secret elixir of love, created with the smell of the monks." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0778749/","name":"Jasminum","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDkyNzM5ZmQtYTFmNi00ZGI3LWI2MjctNzYwMDAwOWM1ZTYyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTc4MzI2NQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"The peaceful world of a monastery, in a small town Jasmine, is destroyed by the arrival of monument restorers, Natasha, along with her daughter Eugenia. programme.desc:
The Last Vermeer: Directed by Dan Friedkin. With Guy Pearce, Claes Bang, Vicky Krieps, Roland Møller. An artist is suspected of selling a valuable painting to the Nazis, but there is more to the story than meets the eye." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt8337320/","name":"The Last Vermeer","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMWE1NzcyOGYtMmY4Zi00NTA3LWE0OGQtM2RlNGI4Y2JlZTAyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMDA4NzMyOA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"An artist is suspected of selling a valuable painting to the Nazis, but there is more to the story than meets the eye.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt8337320/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"celt007"},"dateCreated":"2021-02-24","inLanguage":"English","name":"Pearce is fantastic","reviewBody":"Interesting and intriguing story of post ww2 society in Holland .

Great acting but Pearce and others . Directed and beautifully filmed .

If you like historical dramas I would recommend this movie .","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":2272,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.7},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"2020-11-20","keywords":"one word title,world war two,nazi,painter,art","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3152527641","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNmVmNWY0OGUtOGE4ZS00OWZkLTllNGItMDk3YmI4Zjg1MTc4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNmVmNWY0OGUtOGE4ZS00OWZkLTllNGItMDk3YmI4Zjg1MTc4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"While Joseph Piller (Bang), a Dutch Jew, was fighting in the Resistance during the Second World War, the witty, debonair aesthete, Han van Meegeren (Pearce) was hosting hedonistic soirées and selling Dutch art treasures to Hermann Goring and other top Nazis. Following the war, Piller becomes an investigator assigned the task of identifying and redistributing stolen art, resulting in the flamboyant van Meegeren being accused of collaboration - a crime punishable by death. But, despite mounting evidence, Piller, with the aid of his assistant (Krieps), becomes increasingly convinced of Han's innocence and finds himself in the unlikely position of fighting to save his life."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001602/","name":"Guy Pearce"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0051903/","name":"Claes Bang"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3043279/","name":"Vicky Krieps"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm6679051/","name":"Dan Friedkin"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0473978/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0241129/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0650089/","name":"John Orloff"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1318843/","name":"Mark Fergus"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1319757/","name":"Hawk Ostby"}],"duration":"PT1H58M"}</script><metacontent="

Following the war, Piller becomes an investigator assigned the task of identifying and redistributing stolen art, resulting in the flamboyant van Meegeren being accused of collaboration - a crime punishable by death. But, despite mounting evidence, Piller, with the aid of his assistant (Krieps), becomes increasingly convinced of Han's innocence and finds himself in the unlikely position of fighting to save his life.","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001602/","name":"Guy Pearce","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0051903/","name":"Claes Bang","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3043279/","name":"Vicky Krieps"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm6679051/","name":"Dan Friedkin"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0473978/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0241129/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0650089/","name":"John Orloff","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1318843/","name":"Mark Fergus","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1319757/","name":"Hawk Ostby"],"duration":"PT1H58M"</script><metacontent=" --- Director: Dan Friedkin

programme.title: Czego nam nie mówią o odchudzaniu
programme.desc: Dokument poświęcony tematowi utraty wagi. Jego twórcy chcą pokazać, w jaki sposób branże spożywcza, farmaceutyczna i medyczna oszukują klientów, proponując produkty i usługi, które zamiast pomóc im schudnąć, uszczuplają jedynie ich portfele. Widzowie dowiedzą się, jak myśleć o jedzeniu w nowy sposób i zobaczą, jak najlepiej się odchudzać, by proces ten był skuteczny i długotrwały.

programme.title: The Abyss
Otchłań
The Abyss
programme.desc:
The Abyss: Directed by James Cameron. With Ed Harris, Mary Elizabeth Mastrantonio, Michael Biehn, Leo Burmester. A civilian diving team is enlisted to search for a lost nuclear submarine and faces danger while encountering an alien aquatic species." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0096754/","name":"The Abyss","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYWMzMDNlMDQtMTYyYi00OTM3LTllZDYtYThhMTk5MzNhZTRhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMDUyOTUyNQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A civilian diving team is enlisted to search for a lost nuclear submarine and faces danger while encountering an alien aquatic species.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0096754/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"mstomaso"},"dateCreated":"2005-07-05","inLanguage":"English","name":"Epic original sci-fi adventure with a lot of heart, action, suspense, and brains","reviewBody":"The Abyss is one of my all-time favorite sci-fi films. It mixes hard science with abject fantasy to make moral and philosophical points about the human condition and our place in the universe without the usual clichés. And it does so with good dialog, strong characterization, and intensely emotional acting. Harris and Mastrantonio are absolutely electric together and dominate the screen, but the entire cast deserves plenty of credit. The production itself is mesmerizing despite its vast scale and tastefully used special effects. The film is long, but worth every second of the experience, and the slightly lengthier, more detailed Special Edition version is even better than the original.

Ostensibly, this is a film about first contact with non-terrestrial intelligence. But the story allegorically deals with an amazing array of themes common to great dramas - violence, love, capitalism, war, courage and cowardice. The hardest, most obedient soldier in the film, played spectacularly by Michael Biehn, is a coward, and a man who is hopelessly in love with his estranged wife (Harris) turns that love into an act of suicidal heroism which might unintentionally save the world. And yet nothing is exactly as it seems to be, and there are really no spoilers in this review. There are so many subtle and sensitively developed themes in this film that it is hard to imagine a more epically human drama in the sci-fi genre. Even so, this is a film which entertains at every level, and will satisfy the action fan as much as the wannabe film critic. ;-) 

Most of the film takes place on an experimental submarine drilling platform owned by a petroleum company. A nuclear sub has been lost in "the abyss" - a subduction trench near the Caiman Islands - after encountering an impossibly fast object. Soon, the US military commandeers the platform and its command ship - The Benthic Explorer - to attempt a rescue mission. As everything begins to go wrong, and the encounters with strange phenomena continue, the Navy SEAL in charge of the rescue attempt begins to crack. Meanwhile, on the surface, accusations concerning the sub are escalating between the USSR and USA, and nuclear war seems immanent. This describes just a small segment of the deliciously complex plot that unfolds in The Abyss. You'll have to see it to enjoy the rest.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":170619,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.5},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Adventure","Drama","Mystery"],"datePublished":"1989-08-09","keywords":"submarine,trapped underwater,pantyhose,ocean,drowning","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Abyss","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2643788057","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYThkYjlhNGItN2Q1MC00Yjk5LWIwNzEtYWZiYjkxZDU1ZTFlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYThkYjlhNGItN2Q1MC00Yjk5LWIwNzEtYWZiYjkxZDU1ZTFlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Theatrical Trailer from 20th Century Fox"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000438/","name":"Ed Harris"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001512/","name":"Mary Elizabeth Mastrantonio"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000299/","name":"Michael Biehn"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000116/","name":"James Cameron"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0000756/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0092551/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0038663/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000116/","name":"James Cameron"}],"duration":"PT2H20M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Children Act
W imię dziecka
The Children Act
programme.desc:
The Children Act: Directed by Richard Eyre. With Stanley Tucci, Emma Thompson, Jason Watkins, Ben Chaplin. As her marriage crumbles, a judge must decide a case involving a teenage boy who is refusing a blood transfusion on religious principle." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt6040662/","name":"The Children Act","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODUwOTk1MzI3NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNTI4NDE3NTM@._V1_.jpg","description":"As her marriage crumbles, a judge must decide a case involving a teenage boy who is refusing a blood transfusion on religious principle.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt6040662/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"bob-the-movie-man"},"dateCreated":"2018-08-26","inLanguage":"English","name":""And the Oscar goes to"... (or should go to)... "Dame Emma Thompson".","reviewBody":"Judge Maye (Thompson) is a childless wife to her loving husband Jack (Tucci), but is also a workaholic. This is driving the long-term couple to the point of infidelity: a fact the ever-focused Fiona - whose life, to her, probably feels to be in a perfect if selfish equilibrium - is oblivious to. With Fiona's intense but comfortable world about to cave in around her, her increasing stress is not helped by the latest case she is working on: one where Adam ( Fionn Whitehead from "Dunkirk"), a Jehovah's Witness boy and a minor, is refusing on religious grounds the blood transfusion he desperately needs to fight his lukaemia. Fiona's decisions in the months ahead go much further than a simple judgement on the case.

Two acting giants - one born in London; one born in New York - tower over this Ian McEwan adaptation like leviathons. I bandy around the phrase "national treasure" a lot in my reviews, but here Emma Thompson is simply breathtakingly powerful in the lead role of Judge Fiona Maye, exhibiting such extremes of emotion that you would like to think that an Oscar nomination would be assured. (However, before I run out and put a £10 bet on her to win, the film is such a small British film that unfortunately both a nomination and a win seem unlikely! THIS IS A CRIME! Please share and lobby people, lobby! Perhaps at the very least we can hope for some BAFTA recognition). 

Sometimes a masterly lead performance can make a co-star performance seem unbalanced, but no such danger here. Stanley Tucci makes a perfect acting foil for Thompson: if he were a wine he would be described as "exasperation, frustration, compassion with strong notes of respect". And he carries it off with perfection.

This is an incredibly intelligent film, working on so many different levels and subject to so much interpretation. Fiona's feelings for the troubled teenager feel more maternal than sexual, but when those feelings become returned and escalate the whole piece develops a queasily oedipal quality. Many films have focused on illicit attractions between teacher and pupil, but here lies a new variation, with Maye fighting against her best professional insticts to 'do the right thing'. "I'm frightened of myself" she eventually wails to a colleague. 

In his opening hospital scenes, (not withstanding the comic similarities between the guitar scene here and a certain scene in "Airplane"!), Adam seems completely other-wordly compared to a typical teen and this comes across as utterly false. That is, until you consider the oddness of his family background and Jehovah's Witness upbringing. As such, the film just about gets away with it. Whitehead does a good job with a difficult role. 

If you've been in a court, you'll know that there is something regal and magical about a judge in full regalia entering a packed courtroom. So it's unusual to see the view from the other side of the door... a non-descript office corridor and a non-descript door. Helping the judge on this side of the door is her PA Nigel, played by the brilliant Jason Watkins: a TV regular (e.g. "Line of Duty", "W1A") but seen far less at the movies. 

As a story of obsessive fixation, it borders on McEwan's disturbing earlier work "Enduring Love". And it has the potential to go in lots of interesting directions as a sort of bonkers platonic love triangle ("He wants to live with US?" splutters Tucci). Where the story does end up going was not particularly to my liking, and a melodramatic concert scene was - for me - a little overdone. However it does give rise to a scene (the 'sopping wet' scene) that shows Thompson at her most brilliant: if she DID get Oscar or BAFTA nominated then this will be her pre-announcement snippet.

It's a great film for showcasing acting talent, but beware: it's short on laughs, not remotely uplifting and takes a while to mentally recover from!","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":12172,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.7},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"2018-08-24","keywords":"female judge,husband wife relationship,teenage boy,teenager,17 year old","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2677390105","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOGIzYmNjOGItNWY1ZC00ZmI5LWFhMGMtZTI0OGMwYTczNmE5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOGIzYmNjOGItNWY1ZC00ZmI5LWFhMGMtZTI0OGMwYTczNmE5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"As her marriage to Jack (Stanley Tucci) flounders, eminent High Court judge Fiona Maye (Emma Thompson) has a life-changing decision to make at work - should she force a teenage boy, Adam (Fionn Whitehead), to have the blood transfusion that will save his life? Her unorthodox visit to his hospital bedside has a profound impact on them both, stirring strong new emotions in the boy and long-buried feelings in her."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001804/","name":"Stanley Tucci"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000668/","name":"Emma Thompson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0914327/","name":"Jason Watkins"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0264236/","name":"Richard Eyre"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0209419/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0103694/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0251858/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0568605/","name":"Ian McEwan"}],"duration":"PT1H45M"}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 6040662, Title: The Children Act, --- Description: The Children Act: Directed by Richard Eyre. With Stanley Tucci, Emma Thompson, Jason Watkins, Ben Chaplin. As her marriage crumbles, a judge must decide a case involving a teenage boy who is refusing a blood transfusion on religious principle." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt6040662/","name":"The Children Act","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODUwOTk1MzI3NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNTI4NDE3NTM@._V1_.jpg","description":"As her marriage crumbles, a judge must decide a case involving a teenage boy who is refusing a blood transfusion on religious principle.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt6040662/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"bob-the-movie-man","dateCreated":"2018-08-26","inLanguage":"English","name":""And the Oscar goes to"... (or should go to)... "Dame Emma Thompson".","reviewBody":"Judge Maye (Thompson) is a childless wife to her loving husband Jack (Tucci), but is also a workaholic. This is driving the long-term couple to the point of infidelity: a fact the ever-focused Fiona - whose life, to her, probably feels to be in a perfect if selfish equilibrium - is oblivious to. With Fiona's intense but comfortable world about to cave in around her, her increasing stress is not helped by the latest case she is working on: one where Adam ( Fionn Whitehead from "Dunkirk"), a Jehovah's Witness boy and a minor, is refusing on religious grounds the blood transfusion he desperately needs to fight his lukaemia. Fiona's decisions in the months ahead go much further than a simple judgement on the case.

Two acting giants - one born in London; one born in New York - tower over this Ian McEwan adaptation like leviathons. I bandy around the phrase "national treasure" a lot in my reviews, but here Emma Thompson is simply breathtakingly powerful in the lead role of Judge Fiona Maye, exhibiting such extremes of emotion that you would like to think that an Oscar nomination would be assured. (However, before I run out and put a £10 bet on her to win, the film is such a small British film that unfortunately both a nomination and a win seem unlikely! THIS IS A CRIME! Please share and lobby people, lobby! Perhaps at the very least we can hope for some BAFTA recognition). 

Sometimes a masterly lead performance can make a co-star performance seem unbalanced, but no such danger here. Stanley Tucci makes a perfect acting foil for Thompson: if he were a wine he would be described as "exasperation, frustration, compassion with strong notes of respect". And he carries it off with perfection.

This is an incredibly intelligent film, working on so many different levels and subject to so much interpretation. Fiona's feelings for the troubled teenager feel more maternal than sexual, but when those feelings become returned and escalate the whole piece develops a queasily oedipal quality. Many films have focused on illicit attractions between teacher and pupil, but here lies a new variation, with Maye fighting against her best professional insticts to 'do the right thing'. "I'm frightened of myself" she eventually wails to a colleague. 

In his opening hospital scenes, (not withstanding the comic similarities between the guitar scene here and a certain scene in "Airplane"!), Adam seems completely other-wordly compared to a typical teen and this comes across as utterly false. That is, until you consider the oddness of his family background and Jehovah's Witness upbringing. As such, the film just about gets away with it. Whitehead does a good job with a difficult role. 

If you've been in a court, you'll know that there is something regal and magical about a judge in full regalia entering a packed courtroom. So it's unusual to see the view from the other side of the door... a non-descript office corridor and a non-descript door. Helping the judge on this side of the door is her PA Nigel, played by the brilliant Jason Watkins: a TV regular (e.g. "Line of Duty", "W1A") but seen far less at the movies. 

As a story of obsessive fixation, it borders on McEwan's disturbing earlier work "Enduring Love". And it has the potential to go in lots of interesting directions as a sort of bonkers platonic love triangle ("He wants to live with US?" splutters Tucci). Where the story does end up going was not particularly to my liking, and a melodramatic concert scene was - for me - a little overdone. However it does give rise to a scene (the 'sopping wet' scene) that shows Thompson at her most brilliant: if she DID get Oscar or BAFTA nominated then this will be her pre-announcement snippet.

It's a great film for showcasing acting talent, but beware: it's short on laughs, not remotely uplifting and takes a while to mentally recover from!","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":12172,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.7,"contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"2018-08-24","keywords":"female judge,husband wife relationship,teenage boy,teenager,17 year old","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2677390105","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOGIzYmNjOGItNWY1ZC00ZmI5LWFhMGMtZTI0OGMwYTczNmE5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOGIzYmNjOGItNWY1ZC00ZmI5LWFhMGMtZTI0OGMwYTczNmE5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"As her marriage to Jack (Stanley Tucci) flounders, eminent High Court judge Fiona Maye (Emma Thompson) has a life-changing decision to make at work - should she force a teenage boy, Adam (Fionn Whitehead), to have the blood transfusion that will save his life? Her unorthodox visit to his hospital bedside has a profound impact on them both, stirring strong new emotions in the boy and long-buried feelings in her.","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001804/","name":"Stanley Tucci","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000668/","name":"Emma Thompson","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0914327/","name":"Jason Watkins"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0264236/","name":"Richard Eyre"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0209419/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0103694/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0251858/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0568605/","name":"Ian McEwan"],"duration":"PT1H45M"</script><metacontent=" --- Director: Richard Eyre

programme.title: Silk Road
Wirtualne imperium
Silk Road
programme.desc:
Silk Road: Directed by Tiller Russell. With Nick Robinson, Jennifer Yun, Jimmi Simpson, Jason Clarke. Philosophical twenty-something Ross Ulbricht creates Silk Road, a dark net website that sells drugs, while DEA agent Rick Bowden goes undercover to bring him down." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt7937254/","name":"Silk Road","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjM0NzMyMjUtYTE0ZS00YWNhLWFjMTItZTAwYWJkOGI5MGY3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMDA4NzMyOA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Philosophical twenty-something Ross Ulbricht creates Silk Road, a dark net website that sells drugs, while DEA agent Rick Bowden goes undercover to bring him down.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt7937254/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"fciocca"},"dateCreated":"2021-03-15","inLanguage":"English","name":"How such an interesting and fascinating story could be made so boring?","reviewBody":"What the director and screenwriters did not understood is that Silk Road was at the time a big revolution: drugs that were always bought with physical cash transactions, with all risks for being caught on the spot by the police, finally moved to the hidden web, guaranteeing anonymous purchases from all around the world and having them delivered directly at home. The market became so important, that the website started to sell also other kind of products, and this in a little over two years, which is impressive. Nothing of this is portrayed in the movie, which focuses too much on things that does not matter at all. Why giving so much attention to Ulbricht and his girlfriend? Why giving so much space to Bowden? Everything is rushed to a point where certain part of the story are completely skipped: how the founder passed to sell just drugs, to also weapons and fake documents? We don't get to know.

Ulbricht is portrayed just like a clueless guy, that does not have any idea on how to handle his activity, which maybe was partially true, but let me tell you that a guy that he is able to build from the ground up a marketplace so big and important, is not for sure dumb. In fact he finished university and he obtained even a master. Why you did not show the craft of the website? How he came up with the name Silk Road? How he grew his business, which strategies he used? None of this apparently matter on the eyes of creators. We see instead a DEA agent that was transferred to the cybercrimes department, because he completely suck at his job and need just to work a few months to get the pension. We see him hanging around with his informant, that does most of the job that he is supposed to do. Absolutely ridiculous. Moreover is the classic cop that he is not able to understand that time changes and the job is different now, so he is basically the typical boomer, not able to accept having a younger boss, more experienced than him in IT, and he claims that the old way is always the best one. So cliché.

If you really want to make a movie about Silk Road, you should first of all really inform yourself, reading books and watching documentaries about the topic, making tons of research; understanding how this single website changed society, which were the consequences when was shut down and what inspired afterwards. The movie is incomplete, and made by people that clearly did not know anything about it. If you really want to know the true story, please go to watch "Deep Web", as it really explain what happened.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":3}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":3947,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Crime","Drama","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2021-02-19","keywords":"business,drugs,dark net","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi946258201","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODMzYzY1ZTQtZjc3Mi00MWU4LTg1NjQtYmFhMWE3MTIyNGU3XkEyXkFqcGdeQWRvb2xpbmhk._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODMzYzY1ZTQtZjc3Mi00MWU4LTg1NjQtYmFhMWE3MTIyNGU3XkEyXkFqcGdeQWRvb2xpbmhk._V1_.jpg","description":"Inspired by larger-than-life actual events, this riveting crime thriller follows the rise and fall of Silk Road, the infamous darknet site that sent a seismic shock through the World Wide Web. Young, idealistic, and driven to succeed, Ross Ulbricht (Nick Robinson) creates the internet’s first unregulated marketplace: Silk Road. But when it becomes a multimillion-dollar pipeline for illicit drugs, Ross is set on a collision course with Rick Bowden (Jason Clarke), a disreputable and dangerously unpredictable DEA agent, who will use any means necessary to take him down."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3538718/","name":"Nick Robinson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm6066464/","name":"Jennifer Yun"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0801051/","name":"Jimmi Simpson"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1183164/","name":"Tiller Russell"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0518293/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0243819/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0731972/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1183164/","name":"Tiller Russell"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm6365846/","name":"David Kushner"}],"duration":"PT1H52M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.desc: The Guardian Angel: Directed by Arto Halonen. With Josh Lucas, Pilou Asbæk, Rade Serbedzija, Christopher Fulford. The most incredible series of hypnosis crimes in history send an investigator and a hypnotist into a world of psychological manipulation." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt6353036/","name":"The Guardian Angel","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTBlNWQ5MWMtMzE1MC00Mjc4LWE5MTgtYzRmNzY1MjhkMDE4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzg5MzIyOA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"The most incredible series of hypnosis crimes in history send an investigator and a hypnotist into a world of psychological manipulation.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt6353036/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"gmorten-33943"},"dateCreated":"2019-01-16","inLanguage":"English","name":"Excellent thriller","reviewBody":"I must say it was much better than I excepted, as it was a totally unknown or marketed film so far. Josh Lucas was a very convincing villain. Definite must see. Besides "Vice" I would say this is the best film I have seen in a long time.\n\nThis is based on a true story which makes it even scarier. I am looking forward to the upcoming festival screening.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":686,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.3},"genre":["Drama","Mystery","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2018-03-29","keywords":"hypnosis,mind,bank robbery,ex nazi,nazi collaborator","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Teaser","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1535032857","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjcyMjE1MzktOWY3Yi00ZDU2LWEzNjgtZTc1OWE3NjAxNDgyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjcyMjE1MzktOWY3Yi00ZDU2LWEzNjgtZTc1OWE3NjAxNDgyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0524197/","name":"Josh Lucas"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1561982/","name":"Pilou Asbæk"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0784884/","name":"Rade Serbedzija"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0356867/","name":"Arto Halonen"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0041871/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0647432/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0501169/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0356867/","name":"Arto Halonen"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0017749/","name":"William Aldridge"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0054155/","name":"Mitchell Bard"}],"duration":"PT1H42M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Aktualności filmowe+
programme.desc: W cotygodniowym programie zostają przedstawione najbardziej interesujące wydarzenia ze świata kina. Pojawiają się wywiady z osobami związanymi z branżą filmową, prowadzone są rozmowy na temat premier, nowości muzycznych i teatralnych.

programme.title: Muse: Simulation Theory
programme.desc: Grupa naukowców przybywa do opustoszałej hali w Londynie. Ich celem jest zbadanie tajemniczego źródła energii. Nagle zostają przeniesieni do alternatywnej rzeczywistości, gdzie właśnie trwa występ rockowych idoli z zespołu Muse. Rozpoczyna się wielki show, który jest hołdem złożonym fantastyce z lat 80., ze słynnym "Tronem" Stevena Lisbergera na czele.

programme.title: The Abyss
Otchłań
The Abyss
programme.desc:
The Abyss: Directed by James Cameron. With Ed Harris, Mary Elizabeth Mastrantonio, Michael Biehn, Leo Burmester. A civilian diving team is enlisted to search for a lost nuclear submarine and faces danger while encountering an alien aquatic species." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0096754/","name":"The Abyss","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYWMzMDNlMDQtMTYyYi00OTM3LTllZDYtYThhMTk5MzNhZTRhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMDUyOTUyNQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A civilian diving team is enlisted to search for a lost nuclear submarine and faces danger while encountering an alien aquatic species.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0096754/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"mstomaso"},"dateCreated":"2005-07-05","inLanguage":"English","name":"Epic original sci-fi adventure with a lot of heart, action, suspense, and brains","reviewBody":"The Abyss is one of my all-time favorite sci-fi films. It mixes hard science with abject fantasy to make moral and philosophical points about the human condition and our place in the universe without the usual clichés. And it does so with good dialog, strong characterization, and intensely emotional acting. Harris and Mastrantonio are absolutely electric together and dominate the screen, but the entire cast deserves plenty of credit. The production itself is mesmerizing despite its vast scale and tastefully used special effects. The film is long, but worth every second of the experience, and the slightly lengthier, more detailed Special Edition version is even better than the original.

Ostensibly, this is a film about first contact with non-terrestrial intelligence. But the story allegorically deals with an amazing array of themes common to great dramas - violence, love, capitalism, war, courage and cowardice. The hardest, most obedient soldier in the film, played spectacularly by Michael Biehn, is a coward, and a man who is hopelessly in love with his estranged wife (Harris) turns that love into an act of suicidal heroism which might unintentionally save the world. And yet nothing is exactly as it seems to be, and there are really no spoilers in this review. There are so many subtle and sensitively developed themes in this film that it is hard to imagine a more epically human drama in the sci-fi genre. Even so, this is a film which entertains at every level, and will satisfy the action fan as much as the wannabe film critic. ;-) 

Most of the film takes place on an experimental submarine drilling platform owned by a petroleum company. A nuclear sub has been lost in "the abyss" - a subduction trench near the Caiman Islands - after encountering an impossibly fast object. Soon, the US military commandeers the platform and its command ship - The Benthic Explorer - to attempt a rescue mission. As everything begins to go wrong, and the encounters with strange phenomena continue, the Navy SEAL in charge of the rescue attempt begins to crack. Meanwhile, on the surface, accusations concerning the sub are escalating between the USSR and USA, and nuclear war seems immanent. This describes just a small segment of the deliciously complex plot that unfolds in The Abyss. You'll have to see it to enjoy the rest.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":170619,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.5},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Adventure","Drama","Mystery"],"datePublished":"1989-08-09","keywords":"submarine,trapped underwater,pantyhose,ocean,drowning","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Abyss","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2643788057","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYThkYjlhNGItN2Q1MC00Yjk5LWIwNzEtYWZiYjkxZDU1ZTFlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYThkYjlhNGItN2Q1MC00Yjk5LWIwNzEtYWZiYjkxZDU1ZTFlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Theatrical Trailer from 20th Century Fox"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000438/","name":"Ed Harris"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001512/","name":"Mary Elizabeth Mastrantonio"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000299/","name":"Michael Biehn"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000116/","name":"James Cameron"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0000756/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0092551/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0038663/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000116/","name":"James Cameron"}],"duration":"PT2H20M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Hollywood Buzz
programme.desc: W programie nowości kinowe, relacje z planów zdjęciowych oraz ciekawostki związanych z gwiazdami srebrnego ekranu. O pracy nad najnowszymi hollywoodzkimi produkcjami opowiadają ich twórcy - znani reżyserzy i aktorzy. Autorzy magazynu przedstawiają również zwiastuny filmów wchodzących na ekrany kin.

programme.title: Teen Spirit
Moja gwiazda: Teen Spirit
Teen Spirit
programme.desc:
Teen Spirit: Directed by Max Minghella. With Elle Fanning, Agnieszka Grochowska, Archie Madekwe, Zlatko Buric. Violet is a shy teenager who dreams of escaping her small town and pursuing her passion to sing. With the help of an unlikely mentor, she enters a local singing competition that will test her integrity, talent and ambition. Driven by a pop-fueled soundtrack, Teen Spirit is a visceral and stylish spin on the Cinderella story." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt6483364/","name":"Teen Spirit","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjk0MmFmMDAtNDY0YS00MTk2LTkwMGItYWQ5M2U4MzM0ZWM3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNDY2MjcyOTQ@._V1_.jpg","description":"Violet is a shy teenager who dreams of escaping her small town and pursuing her passion to sing. With the help of an unlikely mentor, she enters a local singing competition that will test her integrity, talent and ambition. Driven by","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt6483364/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"NephilimShoto"},"dateCreated":"2020-10-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"A Spirited Effort","reviewBody":"Teen Spirit doesn't try to be something it's not. It provides face-value entertainment for 90 minutes. It's definitely worth watching for Elle Fanning's performance alone.

Acting: 8/10. Fanning is superb (acting, singing and dancing); supporting cast is convincing enough. Plot: 7/10. Good pacing; visual storytelling is favoured over dialogue; average character development; one or two unexpected twists; decent conclusion. Production: 8.5/10. Believable locations, sets, costumes, etc. Soundtrack: 6/10. Notably predictable songs throughout. (Perhaps that was intentional; this is a movie about a pop music contest, after all.)

Overall recommendation: Watch it (once is enough)."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":8319,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.1},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Drama","Music"],"datePublished":"2019-04-19","keywords":"singer,singing,bar singer,bar,horse","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer #2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3412245017","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTUzYTJmNTItZGQ1Yi00Y2E0LWJkMDAtNDkwMjU2NDQ1MGY1XkEyXkFqcGdeQW1yb3NzZXI@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTUzYTJmNTItZGQ1Yi00Y2E0LWJkMDAtNDkwMjU2NDQ1MGY1XkEyXkFqcGdeQW1yb3NzZXI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Violet (Elle Fanning) dreams of pop stardom to escape her small town and shattered family life. When she enters an international singing competition, can she handle the pressure of chasing her dreams?"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1102577/","name":"Elle Fanning"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1377449/","name":"Agnieszka Grochowska"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5994098/","name":"Archie Madekwe"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1540404/","name":"Max Minghella"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0379163/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0121295/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0362154/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1540404/","name":"Max Minghella"}],"duration":"PT1H33M"}</script><metacontent="

Acting: 8/10. Fanning is superb (acting, singing and dancing); supporting cast is convincing enough. Plot: 7/10. Good pacing; visual storytelling is favoured over dialogue; average character development; one or two unexpected twists; decent conclusion. Production: 8.5/10. Believable locations, sets, costumes, etc. Soundtrack: 6/10. Notably predictable songs throughout. (Perhaps that was intentional; this is a movie about a pop music contest, after all.)
