programme.desc: Rams: Directed by Jeremy Sims. With Sam Neill, Michael Caton, Wayne Blair, Kipan Rothbury. A decades-long feud between two sheep farming brothers comes to a head when disaster strikes their flocks." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt8737608/","name":"Rams","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzU0YzE3NmItOTA4YS00NjBjLTg2MDMtNjc0NmU3MTdjMGFjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjE5MjEwMzA@._V1_.jpg","description":"A decades-long feud between two sheep farming brothers comes to a head when disaster strikes their flocks.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt8737608/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"spookyrat1"},"dateCreated":"2021-03-09","inLanguage":"English","name":"Surpasses the Original!","reviewBody":"I've seen both versions and in my opinion this Australian remake of the Icelandic original is superior. Though 20 minutes longer, it successfully wall - papers over the main points of criticism of the original. There's more humour, an explanation offered for the brothers' enmity (a valid criticism of the original) and a far more satisfactory ending, with much less ambiguity.\n\nThe Great Southern Region of Western Australia proves an excellent substitute for the admittedly stunning Icelandic rural locations and Sam Neill contributes a superlative, warmly amusing turn, as the pastoralist brother who just can't quite let go. It really is the stand-out performance of both films. Ewe shouldn't miss it.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1965,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.4},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Drama"],"datePublished":"2020-10-29","keywords":"sheep,australian filmmaking,ram,animal,outback","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Rams","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi906346777","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzViNGMwYmMtOTEyZC00Yzg1LWE0MmUtZmY3OTMzODYyMmEyXkEyXkFqcGdeQVRoaXJkUGFydHlJbmdlc3Rpb25Xb3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzViNGMwYmMtOTEyZC00Yzg1LWE0MmUtZmY3OTMzODYyMmEyXkEyXkFqcGdeQVRoaXJkUGFydHlJbmdlc3Rpb25Xb3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Official Trailer"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000554/","name":"Sam Neill"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0146264/","name":"Michael Caton"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0992370/","name":"Wayne Blair"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0801327/","name":"Jeremy Sims"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0243070/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3777554/","name":"Jules Duncan"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1963886/","name":"Grímur Hákonarson"}],"duration":"PT1H58M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Un homme pressé
Drugie życie pana Alaina
Un homme pressé
programme.desc:
Un homme pressé: Directed by Hervé Mimran. With Fabrice Luchini, Leïla Bekhti, Rebecca Marder, Igor Gotesman. A high profile businessman has let his personal life lapse in favor of corporate success. When he suffers a serious stroke he finds himself stripped back to zero. He learns to rebuild his life with the help of a therapist and his family." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt6948326/","name":"Un homme pressé","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjU1MGQyN2MtYjIyMC00YTVkLTlmMWUtZThiOTJiOTQxYTVmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjY1OTM1Mzc@._V1_.jpg","description":"A high profile businessman has let his personal life lapse in favor of corporate success. When he suffers a serious stroke he finds himself stripped back to zero. He learns to rebuild his life with the help of a therapist and his fam","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt6948326/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Mozjoukine"},"dateCreated":"2019-03-21","inLanguage":"English","name":"French comedy on suspect subject","reviewBody":"We star with the premise that if in a Film like LES INTOUCHABLE spinal paralysis is funny, stroke victims must be good for a laugh though, to give them credit, they do show recovering patient Fabrice Luchini a ward filled with grim fellow victims on respirators unable to move in their beds.

Derived from the non fiction book "J'étais un homme pressé" by Christian Streiff former CEO of Airbus and PSA Peugeot-Citroen, this one shows the rich Luchini character as a hard serving executive who intimidates all. It takes all the Luchini charm to make this guy acceptable.

He collapses on the way to work and we get into the story where, still in denial, Luchini is made to realise that he has lost his control of language, this with a major address to an executive meeting in Geneva coming up - jokes like him greeting people by saying goodbye and other malapropisms that must have given the sub-titlers nighmares. His ordering a turd from an unfazed waiter at the cafe defeats them.

He recruits hospital speech therapist Leïla Bekhti full time and starts to develop drills to restore his lost vocabulary and memory of the lay out of his district. Bored with the kids' picture books she uses he switches to the Jardin des Plantes menagerie and it's real animals.

Drone shot downwards on a speeding express train and we get a King's Speech scene in Geneva which he aces bit is still shown the door.

At which point the film starts again as Luchini settles in to sort out the relationship with his daughter (that doesn't go too well) and Béhkti, before his European hiking tour accompanied by his faithful dog - much stamping of his passport and alpine scenics. The scene setting is particularly deft in this one.

The central performance is superior but when they've set up support players so well it's unsatisfying to not find their stories given an outcome.

Lush feel good European movie of the kind that plays well in English speaking country art theaters."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1493,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.3},"contentRating":"TV-PG","genre":["Comedy","Drama"],"datePublished":"2018-11-07","keywords":"reference to montgomery clift,reference to gregory peck,reference to peter lorre,reference to humphrey bogart,vehicle design","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Bande-annonce [OV]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi247118361","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzdlZjNlMzctY2I3Yi00ZmE2LTgwZTQtYzM4ZDAzMmFmNzkyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzdlZjNlMzctY2I3Yi00ZmE2LTgwZTQtYzM4ZDAzMmFmNzkyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0524528/","name":"Fabrice Luchini"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1871951/","name":"Leïla Bekhti"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2406198/","name":"Rebecca Marder"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1773597/","name":"Hervé Mimran"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0315631/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0172053/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0056755/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1773597/","name":"Hervé Mimran"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0277229/","name":"Hélène Fillières"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm7013534/","name":"Christian Streiff"}],"duration":"PT1H40M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Fantastic Four
Fantastyczna Czwórka
Fantastic Four
programme.desc:
Fantastic Four: Directed by Josh Trank, Stephen E. Rivkin. With Miles Teller, Michael B. Jordan, Kate Mara, Jamie Bell. Four young outsiders teleport to an alternate and dangerous universe which alters their physical form in shocking ways. The four must learn to harness their new abilities and work together to save Earth from a former friend turned enemy." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1502712/","name":"Fantastic Four","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTk0OTMyMDA0OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMzY5NTkzNTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Four young outsiders teleport to an alternate and dangerous universe which alters their physical form in shocking ways. The four must learn to harness their new abilities and work together to save Earth from a former friend turned en","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1502712/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"moviexclusive"},"dateCreated":"2015-08-06","inLanguage":"English","name":"An empty plot and nonexistent character development make this reboot of Marvel's iconic superhero quartet a pointless exercise in ignominy","reviewBody":"Just because you can do it doesn't mean that you should – and this wholly unnecessary and woefully terrible reboot of Marvel's most famous superteam is proof of that axiom. Say what you may about Tim Story's earlier cinematic adaptations, but as generic and middling as they were, they were at the very least entertaining. Unfortunately, the same cannot even be said of Josh Trank's back-to- basics origin story, which plays like a humourless retread of his debut film 'Chronicle' but on a bigger budget – and lest there be any doubt, it is far, far from fantastic.

Not that it doesn't demonstrate such promise; the first act which establishes the friendship between the visionary Reed Richards (Miles Teller) and his tough-guy longtime best pal Ben Grimm (Jamie Bell) as well as the team dynamics between Reed and the other members of his research team – the equally brilliant Sue (Kate Mara), her hot- headed younger brother Johnny (Michael B. Jordan), and malcontent genius Victor Von Doom (Toby Kibbell) – capably lay the foundation for what could have been a character-driven drama based on their clashing personalities. Indeed, after the boys sans Sue decide on a whim following a night of intoxication to put their teleporting machine to the test, how they respond to their newfound super-powers individually and as a team should be an organic evolution from how they were before.

Alas, Trank, who co-wrote the screenplay with 'X-Men' veteran Simon Kinberg and Jeremy Slater, doesn't quite know where to go from there. Rather than setting them on a course that would follow the perennial 'X-Men' theme of inclusiveness versus insularity against the rest of society, our teenage super-heroes are pretty much seen only in an isolated military facility where they are trained and from which they are deployed on covert operations overseas. While Johnny relishes the opportunity to be different, powerful and useful for once in his life, Sue and Ben are not quite so sanguine and participate insofar as there remains a possibility that the Government's research on them would yield some way of reversing their abnormalities. In the meantime, Reed has vanished off the grid, while Victor is presumed dead on the planet they had landed up on in the other dimension.

One senses a conscious decision on the part of Trank to eschew the usual superheroics seen in the recent profusion of Marvel and to a lesser extent DC comic book adaptations, but the middle act drags precisely because Trank never quite finds a compelling substitute. Johnny's potential conflict with Sue and Ben over the Government's exploitation of their super-powers never amounts to anything more than a playground squabble. The estrangement between Johnny and his father (Reg E. Cathey), whose Baxter Institute had overseen the ill- fated project, is under-cooked. And last but not least, Reed's guilt over his teammates' fates as well as his strained friendship with Ben seem to vanish as quickly as he is apprehended and brought back to the facility to aid them in version 2.0 of the same project.

Trank's intention of emphasising the tension within the quartet is evident and admirable, but is ultimately undone by a script that doesn't develop it in any substantive manner. Worse still, it leaves an audience looking for visual spectacle severely wanting, that not even a very busy third act manages to salvage. Doom makes an unsurprising return here as their common enemy, driven by a fusion of body and alien matter to cause global destruction and around whose defeat to ensure the survival of planet Earth becomes a rallying call for the team to unite despite their differences. It is one of the dullest and most unexciting finales we've seen in a Marvel movie, not least for the fact that it doesn't know how to collectively bring together their superpowers except in a tag-team fashion to distract their opponent. 

It is also on the whole one of the ugliest comic book movies we've ever seen. The planet from which the quartet gain their powers is a barren rocky wasteland that has no character or distinction whatsoever, shrouded perpetually with thick grey clouds and given the even more nondescript name of 'Zero'. The energy that gives them their abilities appears as some slimy green goo that belongs entirely in a C-grade Syfy TV movie, while their powers – whether Reed's rubber limbs or Sue's telekinesis or Johnny's pyrotechnics or Ben's rock-covered body – look equally cheesy. It is no wonder too that the eventual showdown, which takes place almost entirely on the planet surface of 'Zero', doesn't play out any much better against such a bland setting, coming off even worse than any of the action scenes in its predecessors.

And certainly, this reboot is in no way better than Tim Story's earlier adaptations, no matter of its ambition of being a darker and more character-driven superhero piece. 'Chronicle' may have been a perfect calling card for Trank, but 'Fantastic Four' shows a young, inexperienced director completely out of his depth, absolutely justifying the advance bad buzz it had spent months battling. It is utterly embarrassing that a film about Marvel's most enduring creations is no better than a live-action 'Power Rangers' movie, but that's exactly the ignominy that this misconceived and badly executed excuse of a superhero movie has wrought.

As is typical with such origin stories, this one ends with the quartet 'stumbling' on their title as they admire their new home in Central City and reflecting on how far they have come. Ben aka the Thing describes their journey as "fantastic"; we're not entirely sure anyone of their audience shares the same sentiment.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":4}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":158698,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.2},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"2015-08-05","keywords":"troubled production,marvel comics,fantastic four,invisibility,superhero team","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Theatrical Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3166483225","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTczNDc3OTkxMV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTY5ODUyNjE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTczNDc3OTkxMV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTY5ODUyNjE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Four young outsiders teleport to an alternate and dangerous universe which alters their physical form in shocking ways. IMDb data; ttnr: 1502712, Title: Fantastic Four, --- Description: Fantastic Four: Directed by Josh Trank, Stephen E. Rivkin. With Miles Teller, Michael B. Jordan, Kate Mara, Jamie Bell. Four young outsiders teleport to an alternate and dangerous universe which alters their physical form in shocking ways. The four must learn to harness their new abilities and work together to save Earth from a former friend turned enemy." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1502712/","name":"Fantastic Four","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTk0OTMyMDA0OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMzY5NTkzNTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Four young outsiders teleport to an alternate and dangerous universe which alters their physical form in shocking ways. The four must learn to harness their new abilities and work together to save Earth from a former friend turned en","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1502712/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"moviexclusive","dateCreated":"2015-08-06","inLanguage":"English","name":"An empty plot and nonexistent character development make this reboot of Marvel's iconic superhero quartet a pointless exercise in ignominy","reviewBody":"Just because you can do it doesn't mean that you should – and this wholly unnecessary and woefully terrible reboot of Marvel's most famous superteam is proof of that axiom. Say what you may about Tim Story's earlier cinematic adaptations, but as generic and middling as they were, they were at the very least entertaining. Unfortunately, the same cannot even be said of Josh Trank's back-to- basics origin story, which plays like a humourless retread of his debut film 'Chronicle' but on a bigger budget – and lest there be any doubt, it is far, far from fantastic.

Not that it doesn't demonstrate such promise; the first act which establishes the friendship between the visionary Reed Richards (Miles Teller) and his tough-guy longtime best pal Ben Grimm (Jamie Bell) as well as the team dynamics between Reed and the other members of his research team – the equally brilliant Sue (Kate Mara), her hot- headed younger brother Johnny (Michael B. Jordan), and malcontent genius Victor Von Doom (Toby Kibbell) – capably lay the foundation for what could have been a character-driven drama based on their clashing personalities. Indeed, after the boys sans Sue decide on a whim following a night of intoxication to put their teleporting machine to the test, how they respond to their newfound super-powers individually and as a team should be an organic evolution from how they were before.

Alas, Trank, who co-wrote the screenplay with 'X-Men' veteran Simon Kinberg and Jeremy Slater, doesn't quite know where to go from there. Rather than setting them on a course that would follow the perennial 'X-Men' theme of inclusiveness versus insularity against the rest of society, our teenage super-heroes are pretty much seen only in an isolated military facility where they are trained and from which they are deployed on covert operations overseas. While Johnny relishes the opportunity to be different, powerful and useful for once in his life, Sue and Ben are not quite so sanguine and participate insofar as there remains a possibility that the Government's research on them would yield some way of reversing their abnormalities. In the meantime, Reed has vanished off the grid, while Victor is presumed dead on the planet they had landed up on in the other dimension.

One senses a conscious decision on the part of Trank to eschew the usual superheroics seen in the recent profusion of Marvel and to a lesser extent DC comic book adaptations, but the middle act drags precisely because Trank never quite finds a compelling substitute. Johnny's potential conflict with Sue and Ben over the Government's exploitation of their super-powers never amounts to anything more than a playground squabble. The estrangement between Johnny and his father (Reg E. Cathey), whose Baxter Institute had overseen the ill- fated project, is under-cooked. And last but not least, Reed's guilt over his teammates' fates as well as his strained friendship with Ben seem to vanish as quickly as he is apprehended and brought back to the facility to aid them in version 2.0 of the same project.

Trank's intention of emphasising the tension within the quartet is evident and admirable, but is ultimately undone by a script that doesn't develop it in any substantive manner. Worse still, it leaves an audience looking for visual spectacle severely wanting, that not even a very busy third act manages to salvage. Doom makes an unsurprising return here as their common enemy, driven by a fusion of body and alien matter to cause global destruction and around whose defeat to ensure the survival of planet Earth becomes a rallying call for the team to unite despite their differences. It is one of the dullest and most unexciting finales we've seen in a Marvel movie, not least for the fact that it doesn't know how to collectively bring together their superpowers except in a tag-team fashion to distract their opponent. 

It is also on the whole one of the ugliest comic book movies we've ever seen. The planet from which the quartet gain their powers is a barren rocky wasteland that has no character or distinction whatsoever, shrouded perpetually with thick grey clouds and given the even more nondescript name of 'Zero'. The energy that gives them their abilities appears as some slimy green goo that belongs entirely in a C-grade Syfy TV movie, while their powers – whether Reed's rubber limbs or Sue's telekinesis or Johnny's pyrotechnics or Ben's rock-covered body – look equally cheesy. It is no wonder too that the eventual showdown, which takes place almost entirely on the planet surface of 'Zero', doesn't play out any much better against such a bland setting, coming off even worse than any of the action scenes in its predecessors.

And certainly, this reboot is in no way better than Tim Story's earlier adaptations, no matter of its ambition of being a darker and more character-driven superhero piece. 'Chronicle' may have been a perfect calling card for Trank, but 'Fantastic Four' shows a young, inexperienced director completely out of his depth, absolutely justifying the advance bad buzz it had spent months battling. It is utterly embarrassing that a film about Marvel's most enduring creations is no better than a live-action 'Power Rangers' movie, but that's exactly the ignominy that this misconceived and badly executed excuse of a superhero movie has wrought.

As is typical with such origin stories, this one ends with the quartet 'stumbling' on their title as they admire their new home in Central City and reflecting on how far they have come. Ben aka the Thing describes their journey as "fantastic"; we're not entirely sure anyone of their audience shares the same sentiment.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":4,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":158698,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.2,"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"2015-08-05","keywords":"troubled production,marvel comics,fantastic four,invisibility,superhero team","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Theatrical Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3166483225","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTczNDc3OTkxMV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTY5ODUyNjE@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTczNDc3OTkxMV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTY5ODUyNjE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Four young outsiders teleport to an alternate and dangerous universe which alters their physical form in shocking ways. programme.title: Każdy ma swoje lato
programme.desc: Lato w Trzebini. Siedemnastoletni Mirek, syn konserwatywnej kościelnej organistki, dorabia u miejscowego rzeźnika, a po pracy spotyka się z kolegami i opiekuje cierpiącym na demencję dziadkiem. Jego życie odmienia przyjazd zbuntowanej Agaty. Chłopak zbliża się do seksownej i pozornie beztroskiej dziewczyny.

Haven't quite worked out what it's satirising, but I'm pretty hungover today so trying not to think too hard...","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":88396,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.5,"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Horror","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2020-03-13","keywords":"hunting humans,gun,satire,human hunted down for sport,reference to animal farm the novel","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi189054745","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjUzODFkYmUtMjNkYi00MzEzLTgwMzUtNGY3NTg3M2E1ZmIxXkEyXkFqcGdeQWFybm8@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjUzODFkYmUtMjNkYi00MzEzLTgwMzUtNGY3NTg3M2E1ZmIxXkEyXkFqcGdeQWFybm8@._V1_.jpg","description":"The most talked about movie of the year is the one nobody has seen … yet.\r\n \r\nTwelve strangers wake up in a clearing. programme.title: Quello che non sai di me: WT
To, czego o mnie nie wiesz
Quello che non sai di me
programme.desc: Quello che non sai di me: WT: Directed by Rolando Colla. With Francesco Cortopassi, Sara D'Amario, Cristian Izzo, Alfie Nze. Patricia and Ikendu meet in a town in Italian-speaking Switzerland. He comes from Mali, she's employed and the single mother of two daughters. He keeps silent about the reasons for his flight, but he's a fantastic cook and brings warmth and stability into the chaos that is Patricia's life. After their wedding, they live a carefree life, without asking each other too many questions. But one day, Ikendu is arrested and incriminated as a drug dealer by his co-defendants. Now, a difficult period begins for the couple. They both find out things they had previously hidden from one another. At times, this leaves them speechless, at others it causes violent arguments. They often don't understand the world any longer. Nonetheless their relationship takes an important step forward." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt7805896/","name":"Quello che non sai di me: WT","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTFkODhlNTctMDRlMy00ZjlkLThlZjQtNWMwNzk4YWE1OWQ2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjU0NTI0Nw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Patricia and Ikendu meet in a town in Italian-speaking Switzerland. programme.desc: Bis die Welt einen Rand bekommt: Directed by Daniel Bertram. With Lisa Hagmeister, Günther Harder, Alicia Valencia Pollex. The five-year-old Flo cannot understand the condition that her father is in. Her mother explains: "He is with us but also far away at the same time". programme.title: Pili
Pili
programme.desc: Pili: Directed by Leanne Welham. With Bello Rashid, Nkwabi Elias Ng'angasamala, Sesilia Florian Kilimila, Sikijua Rashid. In Tanzania, a single mother is offered the chance to improve her circumstances, but the risks she faces have deepening consequences as she struggles to keep her HIV-positive status secret." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt5827020/","name":"Pili","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODVkZWMxZWQtMDQ4Mi00MjlhLWFkOWYtMjg5YTFkZmJlOWJlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTMxMTY0OTQ@._V1_.jpg","description":"In Tanzania, a single mother is offered the chance to improve her circumstances, but the risks she faces have deepening consequences as she struggles to keep her HIV-positive status secret.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt5827020/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"UKscreenwriter"},"dateCreated":"2021-03-29","inLanguage":"English","name":"I thought this film was amazing!","reviewBody":"I caught this by chance not knowing a thing about it and thought it was extraordinary. It's as if Ken Loach had made a film about the struggles of a single African mother with a debilitating medical condition fighting to survive. Pili faces hardship and the worse kind of exploitation however there are no evil characters here, everyone has a point of view, which makes this a profound film about the human condition. The film-makers show respect to the subject matter, it is never patronising and there are no silly or unbelievable scenes. I hardly ever write reviews and I'm surprised no one else has reviewed this film or that it has had to little coverage.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":181,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.7},"genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"2018-10-12","keywords":"one word title,title directed by female,female protagonist,black woman,hiv","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm8234994/","name":"Bello Rashid"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5401663/","name":"Nkwabi Elias Ng'angasamala"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm8234995/","name":"Sesilia Florian Kilimila"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2801121/","name":"Leanne Welham"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0220392/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm8234998/","name":"Sophie Harman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2801121/","name":"Leanne Welham"}],"duration":"PT1H25M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Héraðið
Daleko od Reykjavíku
Héraðið
programme.desc:
Héraðið: Directed by Grímur Hákonarson. With Arndís Hrönn Egilsdóttir, Sveinn Ólafur Gunnarsson, Þorsteinn Bachmann, Ævar Þór Benediktsson. A widowed farmer begins a new life on her own terms by fighting against corruption and injustice in her community." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt8390612/","name":"Héraðið","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZmUyYTljNzQtYzk4NC00OWIxLTk3MDQtOTM4ZGJiZGZmYjNjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTM4NTIzMTM@._V1_.jpg","description":"A widowed farmer begins a new life on her own terms by fighting against corruption and injustice in her community.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt8390612/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"valleyjohn"},"dateCreated":"2021-01-05","inLanguage":"English","name":"No laughs here","reviewBody":"It really annoys me when a film is described as a comedy and then you watch it and its quite clearly not. You can't even call this a black comedy because there is nothing remotely funny about the film but that doesn't mean it's a bad.

 It's the story of Inga , who runs a deeply indebted dairy farm in a remote valley in Iceland. After a tragic loss, she decides to rise up against the corrupt establishment exploiting her and the local community. This way the widowed farmer begins a new life on her own terms by fighting against corruption and injustice in her community.

If this was made in another country like The UK or The US , it would have had humour inserted and would probably had a shmaltzy ending. Obviously that's not what's done in Iceland .

This is more of a social statement about how small farms are bullied by big corporations and how one woman stood up to that . I enjoyed watching the fight against the Co op and the way the farmers rallied around but without giving anything away , the fight ends up being fruitless which gives us a strange , flat ending.

Overall i was sold a different film from what i got but it was still very watchable .","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1064,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.5},"genre":["Comedy","Drama"],"datePublished":"2019-08-14","keywords":"singing in a car,redheaded woman,reference to liverpool fc,reference to southampton fc,loss of husband","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer [OVS]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi606518809","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzZiNzg1ZjgtMDZkNi00ZDY5LWEzMWQtODAyYmVjOTk2YzRmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzZiNzg1ZjgtMDZkNi00ZDY5LWEzMWQtODAyYmVjOTk2YzRmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1907967/","name":"Arndís Hrönn Egilsdóttir"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2855195/","name":"Sveinn Ólafur Gunnarsson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0045489/","name":"Þorsteinn Bachmann"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1963886/","name":"Grímur Hákonarson"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0030799/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0453485/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0355821/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1963886/","name":"Grímur Hákonarson"}],"duration":"PT1H32M"}</script><metacontent="

In this prequel, Germán Areta leaves his position as a policeman to become a private detective in post-Francoist Spain." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt6793710/","name":"El crack cero","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZTU1M2U4OWUtZTQ5OS00OWM1LTljN2EtMWJmZDgxNzUwZGNkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTA0MjU0Ng@@._V1_.jpg","description":"In this prequel, Germán Areta leaves his position as a policeman to become a private detective in post-Francoist Spain.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt6793710/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"r-95017"},"dateCreated":"2020-05-16","inLanguage":"English","name":"Pretty bad","reviewBody":"Filmed in black and white, the acting is pretty woeful, it's difficult to want to pay attention when you're constantly confronted with examples or poor editing. It's so bad at times it made me wonder if it's deliberate.

The script has dramatic style to it, adding to the abstract lack of warmth for the characters. I get that he is a PI but I hope nobody has ever needed to look into the distance so many times in 2 hours.

I think it's also generally inconsistent, revelling in what I imagine were seen as character development and setting the seen comes across as predictable. In this prequel, Germán Areta leaves his position as a policeman to become a private detective in post-Francoist Spain." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt6793710/","name":"El crack cero","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZTU1M2U4OWUtZTQ5OS00OWM1LTljN2EtMWJmZDgxNzUwZGNkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTA0MjU0Ng@@._V1_.jpg","description":"In this prequel, Germán Areta leaves his position as a policeman to become a private detective in post-Francoist Spain.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt6793710/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"r-95017","dateCreated":"2020-05-16","inLanguage":"English","name":"Pretty bad","reviewBody":"Filmed in black and white, the acting is pretty woeful, it's difficult to want to pay attention when you're constantly confronted with examples or poor editing. It's so bad at times it made me wonder if it's deliberate.

The script has dramatic style to it, adding to the abstract lack of warmth for the characters. I get that he is a PI but I hope nobody has ever needed to look into the distance so many times in 2 hours.

I think it's also generally inconsistent, revelling in what I imagine were seen as character development and setting the seen comes across as predictable. programme.title: Quello che non sai di me: WT
To, czego o mnie nie wiesz
Quello che non sai di me
programme.desc: Quello che non sai di me: WT: Directed by Rolando Colla. With Francesco Cortopassi, Sara D'Amario, Cristian Izzo, Alfie Nze. Patricia and Ikendu meet in a town in Italian-speaking Switzerland. He comes from Mali, she's employed and the single mother of two daughters. He keeps silent about the reasons for his flight, but he's a fantastic cook and brings warmth and stability into the chaos that is Patricia's life. After their wedding, they live a carefree life, without asking each other too many questions. But one day, Ikendu is arrested and incriminated as a drug dealer by his co-defendants. Now, a difficult period begins for the couple. They both find out things they had previously hidden from one another. At times, this leaves them speechless, at others it causes violent arguments. They often don't understand the world any longer. Nonetheless their relationship takes an important step forward." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt7805896/","name":"Quello che non sai di me: WT","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTFkODhlNTctMDRlMy00ZjlkLThlZjQtNWMwNzk4YWE1OWQ2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjU0NTI0Nw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Patricia and Ikendu meet in a town in Italian-speaking Switzerland. programme.title: Baby Done
Dziecko w drodze
Baby Done
programme.desc: Baby Done: Directed by Curtis Vowell. With Rose Matafeo, Matthew Lewis, Emily Barclay, Rachel House. Wannabe-adventurer Zoe freaks out when she falls pregnant to her long-term boyfriend Tim. As Tim embraces the prospect of fatherhood, Zoe attempts to rush through her dreams." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt9894660/","name":"Baby Done","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZmUwMTEwYTQtYmUyNy00ZThjLWE5ZjAtZWMwZWRlNDc3Y2MzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTExNDQ2MTI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Wannabe-adventurer Zoe freaks out when she falls pregnant to her long-term boyfriend Tim. As Tim embraces the prospect of fatherhood, Zoe attempts to rush through her dreams.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt9894660/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"root_king"},"dateCreated":"2021-03-08","inLanguage":"English","name":"Interesting","reviewBody":"Interesting film, Unique but Nothing remarkable tho.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":993,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.1},"genre":["Comedy"],"datePublished":"2020-10-22","keywords":"pregnant,overalls","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2955985177","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNWNlZDNmMmUtYTM4ZS00NjRlLWE2YTctNWM1M2ZhZTM0MzVjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNWNlZDNmMmUtYTM4ZS00NjRlLWE2YTctNWM1M2ZhZTM0MzVjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"When Zoe (Rose Matafeo) and Tim (Matthew Lewis) find out they are having a baby, they resolve to not let parenthood change them. Tim runs towards being a dad, while Zoe runs away from being a mum. Terrified that her life won't be her own anymore, Zoe is still determined to tick off a list of their wildest dreams before the baby arrives. Zoe's increasing denial about her impending birth pushes her, and her relationship, to the limit. BABY DONE is a semi-autobiographical story inspired by the filmmakers' own reaction to starting a family."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4194124/","name":"Rose Matafeo"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0507535/","name":"Matthew Lewis"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1120593/","name":"Emily Barclay"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3555793/","name":"Curtis Vowell"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0537672/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3089836/","name":"Sophie Henderson"}],"duration":"PT1H31M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.desc: Me, Myself & Irene: Directed by Bobby Farrelly, Peter Farrelly. With Jim Carrey, Renée Zellweger, Anthony Anderson, Mongo Brownlee. A nice-guy cop with Dissociative Identity Disorder must protect a woman on the run from a corrupt ex-boyfriend and his associates." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0183505/","name":"Me, Myself & Irene","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODMwMDY2YzUtNGFiNS00NDA1LWI4YzMtYzVmM2RlZTk3NGVlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"A nice-guy cop with Dissociative Identity Disorder must protect a woman on the run from a corrupt ex-boyfriend and his associates.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0183505/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"capike-1"},"dateCreated":"2007-01-12","inLanguage":"English","name":"It's hilarious !","reviewBody":"Funniest movie I have seen in a long time, wish I had seen it much earlier. I thought I had grown tired of Jim Carrey movies. He seemed like the same character in just about every film. True enough, I can still see elements of the same kind of character in this film, but I think the story is a good one. Renee Zellwegger is lovely and sexy. There were so many funny moments in this movie, from when Jim Carrey nurses on the lovely young mother to the very end when the three boys leave us with "Thank you for watching our **** movie!" I actually got all of my friends to watch this movie with me because I was so excited about it and it's already almost 7 years old. Who knew? I guess that just goes to show that you can't judge an actor or a movie until you've seen it.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":229859,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.6},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy"],"datePublished":"2000-06-23","keywords":"dissociative identity disorder,multiple personality,idiot,sex aid,sex toy","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Me, Myself And Irene","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2824798745","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmMzNzJiYjMtYjkxNC00ZmM5LWI3NWQtNDRiMGI5MGU4NWExXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmMzNzJiYjMtYjkxNC00ZmM5LWI3NWQtNDRiMGI5MGU4NWExXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from 20th Century Fox Home Entertainment"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000120/","name":"Jim Carrey"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000250/","name":"Renée Zellweger"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0026364/","name":"Anthony Anderson"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0125803/","name":"Bobby Farrelly"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0268380/","name":"Peter Farrelly"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0000756/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0030016/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0268380/","name":"Peter Farrelly"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0148808/","name":"Mike Cerrone"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0125803/","name":"Bobby Farrelly"}],"duration":"PT1H56M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Pulp Fiction
Pulp Fiction
programme.desc: Pulp Fiction: Directed by Quentin Tarantino. With Tim Roth, Amanda Plummer, Laura Lovelace, John Travolta. The lives of two mob hitmen, a boxer, a gangster and his wife, and a pair of diner bandits intertwine in four tales of violence and redemption." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0110912/","name":"Pulp Fiction","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGNhMDIzZTUtNTBlZi00MTRlLWFjM2ItYzViMjE3YzI5MjljXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzkwMjQ5NzM@._V1_.jpg","description":"The lives of two mob hitmen, a boxer, a gangster and his wife, and a pair of diner bandits intertwine in four tales of violence and redemption.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0110912/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"wolvesrug"},"dateCreated":"2005-01-09","inLanguage":"English","name":"Simply The Best","reviewBody":"To put this in context, I am 34 years old and I have to say that this is the best film I have seen without doubt and I don't expect it will be beaten as far as I am concerned. Obviously times move on, and I acknowledge that due to its violence and one particularly uncomfortable scene this film is not for everyone, but I still remember watching it for the first time, and it blew me away. Anyone who watches it now has to remember that it actually changed the history of cinema. In context- it followed a decade or more of action films that always ended with a chase sequence where the hero saved the day - you could have written those films yourself. Pulp had you gripped and credited the audience with intelligence. There is not a line of wasted dialogue and the movie incorporates a number of complexities that are not immediately obvious. It also resurrected the career of Grease icon John Travolta and highlighted the acting talent of Samuel L Jackson. There are many films now that are edited out of sequence and have multiple plots etc but this is the one they all want to be, or all want to beat, but never will.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1905493,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.9},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"1994-10-14","keywords":"nonlinear timeline,overdose,drug overdose,drug use,bondage","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2620371481","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjI5MzgxMTQ4M15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNjczMTk0NzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjI5MzgxMTQ4M15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNjczMTk0NzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"The lives of two mob hit men, a boxer, a gangster's wife, and a pair of diner bandits intertwine in four tales of violence and redemption."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000237/","name":"John Travolta"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000235/","name":"Uma Thurman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000168/","name":"Samuel L. Jackson"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000233/","name":"Quentin Tarantino"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0022594/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0019267/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0010434/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000233/","name":"Quentin Tarantino"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000812/","name":"Roger Avary"}],"duration":"PT2H34M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Lowdown Dirty Criminals
Jak zostać zbirem
Lowdown Dirty Criminals
programme.desc: Lowdown Dirty Criminals: Directed by Paul Murphy. With Samuel Austin, Francis Biggs, Unaloto Funaki, Rebecca Gibney. Follows two naïve young men who are in search of a better life, encountering unsavoury situations and people along the way." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt10338808/","name":"Lowdown Dirty Criminals","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYWNjM2YxZDAtYjExNC00NGZlLWJmNTctOGFiZDg2N2ZiMDc3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjc0MTQ5NA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Follows two naïve young men who are in search of a better life, encountering unsavoury situations and people along the way.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt10338808/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"paularoger-94717"},"dateCreated":"2020-08-29","inLanguage":"English","name":"A few funny moments in a Dark Splatter Comedy","reviewBody":"Lowdown has elements of Peter Jackson's early movie Bad Taste and left me with a bad taste and disappointment. I guffawed about 3 times at the most. I'm not sure why but it very quickly came across as non funny charicature and two likeable hapless fools. The head crims were well acted but not believable and distasteful. I hated watching the blood and gore of the dissection. When I think about it there were lots of funny little situations and I wanted to laugh with my friends, but nothing was hilarious, as there was an ever present sense of threat. There were lots of moments of hesitation, while the crims failed in their missions and thought about what to do. The Upholster (Rebecca Gibney) was almost glamorous but wooden, despite her many excellent previous roles. I thought the fight scene with the fat guy, and his later removal from the flat funny/weird. I didn't like all the swearing or the motel girl getting beaten etc. I was all cringe worthy. Sorry. Try again and have some more believable likeable characters.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":3}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":163,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.2},"genre":["Comedy"],"datePublished":"2020-10-31","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3754869017","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjY0MTczNTgtZGI3Mi00NWUxLTlmZDMtNWZiODEwMGU2YmQzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXN3aWZ0dw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjY0MTczNTgtZGI3Mi00NWUxLTlmZDMtNWZiODEwMGU2YmQzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXN3aWZ0dw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Lowdown Dirty Criminals is a black comedy about two friends who decide to work for an underworld character after a fiasco delivering pizza. They botch up the first job delivering a birthday cake to their boss and go on to botch up a hit job etc. the movie has many similarities to Lock Stock and Two Smoking Barrels. After getting tangled up with a scary lady criminal known as the Upholsterer the plot has a messy climax. The two likable hapless crimes walk away from the dark world of crime, learning their lesson and restarting their lives."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm8559032/","name":"Samuel Austin"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3409253/","name":"Francis Biggs"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm10696919/","name":"Unaloto Funaki"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0614609/","name":"Paul Murphy"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0482612/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0717289/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0746577/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1188748/","name":"David Brechin-Smith"}],"duration":"PT1H26M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Whiskey Tango Foxtrot
Whiskey Tango Foxtrot
programme.desc:
Whiskey Tango Foxtrot: Directed by Glenn Ficarra, John Requa. With Tina Fey, Margot Robbie, Martin Freeman, Alfred Molina. A journalist recounts her wartime coverage in Afghanistan." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt3553442/","name":"Whiskey Tango Foxtrot","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjIxOTIzMTM5OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNDIxNTA1NzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A journalist recounts her wartime coverage in Afghanistan.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt3553442/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"jim9tan"},"dateCreated":"2016-03-22","inLanguage":"English","name":"Has soul","reviewBody":"I am impressed. This is one of the few films which has inspired me to read the source material; the autobiography by the journalist Kim Baker..

The film starts with comic moments as greenhorn middle-America Kim Baker (Tina Fey) arrives in a war zone. Then, the film darkens as it touches on the corruption of the expatriate community and the seduction of war reporting.

Surprisingly, Tina Fey can act in a dramatic role. Being comic with a straight face, facing danger, fending off romeos, and falling in love. In the end, Kim Baker rediscovers herself and returns home.

The film deals superficially with the horror faced by Afghan civilians and the root causes of the insurgency. However, this is the story of a white woman in a foreign land.

Overall, the film was predictable but lightly touches the soul. Credit to the editor for walking the difficult line between entertainment and horror. The rest of the cast did a creditable job."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":51354,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.6},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Biography","Comedy","Drama"],"datePublished":"2016-03-04","keywords":"afghanistan,journalist,war on terrorism,kabul afghanistan,karaoke","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer #1","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2132324889","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTU4NjkyODc3MF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwOTcxNTA1NzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTU4NjkyODc3MF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwOTcxNTA1NzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Based on the Kim Barker's memoir, Tina Fey plays a journalist reporting from war-town Afghanistan and Pakistan."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0275486/","name":"Tina Fey"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3053338/","name":"Margot Robbie"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0293509/","name":"Martin Freeman"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0275629/","name":"Glenn Ficarra"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0720135/","name":"John Requa"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0013731/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0199243/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0023400/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1061622/","name":"Robert Carlock"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5092324/","name":"Kim Barker"}],"duration":"PT1H52M"}</script><metacontent="

In this prequel, Germán Areta leaves his position as a policeman to become a private detective in post-Francoist Spain." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt6793710/","name":"El crack cero","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZTU1M2U4OWUtZTQ5OS00OWM1LTljN2EtMWJmZDgxNzUwZGNkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTA0MjU0Ng@@._V1_.jpg","description":"In this prequel, Germán Areta leaves his position as a policeman to become a private detective in post-Francoist Spain.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt6793710/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"r-95017"},"dateCreated":"2020-05-16","inLanguage":"English","name":"Pretty bad","reviewBody":"Filmed in black and white, the acting is pretty woeful, it's difficult to want to pay attention when you're constantly confronted with examples or poor editing. It's so bad at times it made me wonder if it's deliberate.

The script has dramatic style to it, adding to the abstract lack of warmth for the characters. I get that he is a PI but I hope nobody has ever needed to look into the distance so many times in 2 hours.

I think it's also generally inconsistent, revelling in what I imagine were seen as character development and setting the seen comes across as predictable. Even the music annoyed me","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":4}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":648,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.6},"genre":["Drama","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2019-10-04","keywords":"detective","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Tráiler [OV]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3987455769","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjM4YmVjNmItZDA5OC00OWZiLTg5ZGEtMWU3NDY5YzA5NDgzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjM4YmVjNmItZDA5OC00OWZiLTg5ZGEtMWU3NDY5YzA5NDgzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1685281/","name":"Carlos Santos"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0616475/","name":"Miguel Ángel Muñoz"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0310459/","name":"Luisa Gavasa"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0305054/","name":"José Luis Garci"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0012941/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0305054/","name":"José Luis Garci"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1913805/","name":"Javier Muñoz"}],"duration":"PT2H2M"}</script><metacontent="

Baby Done
programme.desc: Baby Done: Directed by Curtis Vowell. With Rose Matafeo, Matthew Lewis, Emily Barclay, Rachel House. Wannabe-adventurer Zoe freaks out when she falls pregnant to her long-term boyfriend Tim. As Tim embraces the prospect of fatherhood, Zoe attempts to rush through her dreams." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt9894660/","name":"Baby Done","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZmUwMTEwYTQtYmUyNy00ZThjLWE5ZjAtZWMwZWRlNDc3Y2MzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTExNDQ2MTI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Wannabe-adventurer Zoe freaks out when she falls pregnant to her long-term boyfriend Tim. As Tim embraces the prospect of fatherhood, Zoe attempts to rush through her dreams.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt9894660/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"root_king"},"dateCreated":"2021-03-08","inLanguage":"English","name":"Interesting","reviewBody":"Interesting film, Unique but Nothing remarkable tho.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":993,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.1},"genre":["Comedy"],"datePublished":"2020-10-22","keywords":"pregnant,overalls","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2955985177","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNWNlZDNmMmUtYTM4ZS00NjRlLWE2YTctNWM1M2ZhZTM0MzVjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNWNlZDNmMmUtYTM4ZS00NjRlLWE2YTctNWM1M2ZhZTM0MzVjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"When Zoe (Rose Matafeo) and Tim (Matthew Lewis) find out they are having a baby, they resolve to not let parenthood change them. Tim runs towards being a dad, while Zoe runs away from being a mum. Terrified that her life won't be her own anymore, Zoe is still determined to tick off a list of their wildest dreams before the baby arrives. Zoe's increasing denial about her impending birth pushes her, and her relationship, to the limit. BABY DONE is a semi-autobiographical story inspired by the filmmakers' own reaction to starting a family."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4194124/","name":"Rose Matafeo"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0507535/","name":"Matthew Lewis"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1120593/","name":"Emily Barclay"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3555793/","name":"Curtis Vowell"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0537672/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3089836/","name":"Sophie Henderson"}],"duration":"PT1H31M"}</script><metacontent="

Alice
programme.desc: Line of Duty: Directed by Steven C. Miller. With Aaron Eckhart, Courtney Eaton, Ben McKenzie, Giancarlo Esposito. A disgraced cop finds himself in a race against time to find a kidnap victim whose abductor he accidentally killed." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt3541524/","name":"Line of Duty","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTkxYzIxOTYtNDkzOS00NWZjLWFjM2YtY2RhNDNkNGU1OTRkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyODk0OTcwMTk@._V1_.jpg","description":"A disgraced cop finds himself in a race against time to find a kidnap victim whose abductor he accidentally killed.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt3541524/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"vovers1"},"dateCreated":"2019-11-17","inLanguage":"English","name":"Yes it's unbelievable but still fun to watch","reviewBody":"Totally unbelievable story-line and acting are combined with fast-paced action and lots of setup scenes. The act that you can guess what is coming next is probably what keeps you watching. Most of the storytelling is delivered with tongue in cheek humor while people are dying right left and center. The baddies are super smart, the good guys and authorities totally inept except the heroes and the result is Hallmark. Puts the movie in the middle of the line, not great, not bad, interesting use of the power of social media. I've seen a lot worse.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":6463,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.3},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Crime","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2019-11-15","keywords":"female reporter,amateur reporter,vlogger,police action,three word title","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2615983897","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjM4OTVlMGItY2I3Yi00N2FkLWJlOGYtZmRhMjM0YmU0MmMxXkEyXkFqcGdeQUlNRGJWaWRlb1RodW1ibmFpbFNlcnZpY2U@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjM4OTVlMGItY2I3Yi00N2FkLWJlOGYtZmRhMjM0YmU0MmMxXkEyXkFqcGdeQUlNRGJWaWRlb1RodW1ibmFpbFNlcnZpY2U@._V1_.jpg","description":"Frank Penny is a disgraced cop looking for a shot at redemption. When the police chief's 11-year-old daughter is abducted, Frank goes rogue to try and save her. But to find the girl, Frank will need the help of Ava Brooks (Courtney Eaton), whose live-streaming news channel is broadcasting Frank's every move. While a city watches, Frank and Ava race against time in this explosive action-thriller."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001173/","name":"Aaron Eckhart"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5196907/","name":"Courtney Eaton"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1360270/","name":"Ben McKenzie"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1921345/","name":"Steven C. programme.title: Cheung gong 7 hou
CJ7
Cheung gong 7 hou
programme.desc: Cheung gong 7 hou: Directed by Stephen Chow. With Stephen Chow, Jiao Xu, Lei Huang, Yuqi Zhang. A poor Chinese laborer learns important lessons after his son gets a strange new toy." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0940709/","name":"Cheung gong 7 hou","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTUxNTQxNTY5OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNjEyNjg1MQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A poor Chinese laborer learns important lessons after his son gets a strange new toy.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0940709/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"ukidding"},"dateCreated":"2008-04-02","inLanguage":"English","name":"Truly wonderful story, humorously narrated","reviewBody":"For someone like me, born and raised in China in a poor family, Chow's work was absolutely fantastic! CJ-7 constantly reminds me of those poorly happy times I have spent with my friends and family during my childhood, flashing to my mind those very basic and simplistic values of living to an average Chinese boy like myself. Nostalgic with a touch of humor, to me this movie is simply a 10 star hit! But, viewing it from a more literal perspective, people will see this work as "the same old stuff"... over and over again... that is true, from the use of mo lei tau comedy to computer CG, Chow has not made any improvements not to mention innovation ever since his "Shaolin Soccer" world class movie debut. This generally deducted the 2 stars from the rating.\n\nBut compared with a lot of the 3rd rated movies released in 2008 out there, this is sure worth the time!","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":15282,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.4},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Family"],"datePublished":"2008-01-30","keywords":"father son relationship,bullying,lollipop,china,cockroach","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"U.S. trailer: CJ7","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1991377177","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ1NzE5ODg5NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNjkwMjczMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ1NzE5ODg5NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNjkwMjczMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"This is the U.S. theatrical trailer for CJ7, directed by Stephen Chow."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0159507/","name":"Stephen Chow"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2514879/","name":"Yuqi Zhang"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2922341/","name":"Jiao Xu"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0159507/","name":"Stephen Chow"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0041248/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0020819/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0049799/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0159507/","name":"Stephen Chow"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0463674/","name":"Vincent Kok"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0874683/","name":"Kan-Cheung Tsang"}],"duration":"PT1H28M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Me, Myself & Irene
Ja, Irena i Ja
Me, Myself & Irene
programme.desc: Me, Myself & Irene: Directed by Bobby Farrelly, Peter Farrelly. With Jim Carrey, Renée Zellweger, Anthony Anderson, Mongo Brownlee. A nice-guy cop with Dissociative Identity Disorder must protect a woman on the run from a corrupt ex-boyfriend and his associates." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0183505/","name":"Me, Myself & Irene","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODMwMDY2YzUtNGFiNS00NDA1LWI4YzMtYzVmM2RlZTk3NGVlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"A nice-guy cop with Dissociative Identity Disorder must protect a woman on the run from a corrupt ex-boyfriend and his associates.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0183505/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"capike-1"},"dateCreated":"2007-01-12","inLanguage":"English","name":"It's hilarious !","reviewBody":"Funniest movie I have seen in a long time, wish I had seen it much earlier. I thought I had grown tired of Jim Carrey movies. He seemed like the same character in just about every film. True enough, I can still see elements of the same kind of character in this film, but I think the story is a good one. Renee Zellwegger is lovely and sexy. There were so many funny moments in this movie, from when Jim Carrey nurses on the lovely young mother to the very end when the three boys leave us with "Thank you for watching our **** movie!" I actually got all of my friends to watch this movie with me because I was so excited about it and it's already almost 7 years old. Who knew? I guess that just goes to show that you can't judge an actor or a movie until you've seen it.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":229859,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.6},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy"],"datePublished":"2000-06-23","keywords":"dissociative identity disorder,multiple personality,idiot,sex aid,sex toy","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Me, Myself And Irene","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2824798745","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmMzNzJiYjMtYjkxNC00ZmM5LWI3NWQtNDRiMGI5MGU4NWExXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmMzNzJiYjMtYjkxNC00ZmM5LWI3NWQtNDRiMGI5MGU4NWExXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from 20th Century Fox Home Entertainment"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000120/","name":"Jim Carrey"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000250/","name":"Renée Zellweger"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0026364/","name":"Anthony Anderson"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0125803/","name":"Bobby Farrelly"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0268380/","name":"Peter Farrelly"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0000756/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0030016/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0268380/","name":"Peter Farrelly"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0148808/","name":"Mike Cerrone"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0125803/","name":"Bobby Farrelly"}],"duration":"PT1H56M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Whiskey Tango Foxtrot
Whiskey Tango Foxtrot
programme.desc:
Whiskey Tango Foxtrot: Directed by Glenn Ficarra, John Requa. With Tina Fey, Margot Robbie, Martin Freeman, Alfred Molina. A journalist recounts her wartime coverage in Afghanistan." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt3553442/","name":"Whiskey Tango Foxtrot","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjIxOTIzMTM5OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNDIxNTA1NzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A journalist recounts her wartime coverage in Afghanistan.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt3553442/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"jim9tan"},"dateCreated":"2016-03-22","inLanguage":"English","name":"Has soul","reviewBody":"I am impressed. This is one of the few films which has inspired me to read the source material; the autobiography by the journalist Kim Baker..

The film starts with comic moments as greenhorn middle-America Kim Baker (Tina Fey) arrives in a war zone. Then, the film darkens as it touches on the corruption of the expatriate community and the seduction of war reporting.

Surprisingly, Tina Fey can act in a dramatic role. Being comic with a straight face, facing danger, fending off romeos, and falling in love. In the end, Kim Baker rediscovers herself and returns home.

The film deals superficially with the horror faced by Afghan civilians and the root causes of the insurgency. However, this is the story of a white woman in a foreign land.

Overall, the film was predictable but lightly touches the soul. Credit to the editor for walking the difficult line between entertainment and horror. The rest of the cast did a creditable job."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":51354,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.6},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Biography","Comedy","Drama"],"datePublished":"2016-03-04","keywords":"afghanistan,journalist,war on terrorism,kabul afghanistan,karaoke","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer #1","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2132324889","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTU4NjkyODc3MF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwOTcxNTA1NzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTU4NjkyODc3MF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwOTcxNTA1NzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Based on the Kim Barker's memoir, Tina Fey plays a journalist reporting from war-town Afghanistan and Pakistan."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0275486/","name":"Tina Fey"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3053338/","name":"Margot Robbie"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0293509/","name":"Martin Freeman"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0275629/","name":"Glenn Ficarra"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0720135/","name":"John Requa"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0013731/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0199243/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0023400/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1061622/","name":"Robert Carlock"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5092324/","name":"Kim Barker"}],"duration":"PT1H52M"}</script><metacontent="

A journalist recounts her wartime coverage in Afghanistan." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt3553442/","name":"Whiskey Tango Foxtrot","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjIxOTIzMTM5OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNDIxNTA1NzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A journalist recounts her wartime coverage in Afghanistan.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt3553442/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"jim9tan","dateCreated":"2016-03-22","inLanguage":"English","name":"Has soul","reviewBody":"I am impressed. This is one of the few films which has inspired me to read the source material; the autobiography by the journalist Kim Baker..

The film starts with comic moments as greenhorn middle-America Kim Baker (Tina Fey) arrives in a war zone. Then, the film darkens as it touches on the corruption of the expatriate community and the seduction of war reporting.

Surprisingly, Tina Fey can act in a dramatic role. Being comic with a straight face, facing danger, fending off romeos, and falling in love. In the end, Kim Baker rediscovers herself and returns home.

The film deals superficially with the horror faced by Afghan civilians and the root causes of the insurgency. However, this is the story of a white woman in a foreign land.

Overall, the film was predictable but lightly touches the soul. Credit to the editor for walking the difficult line between entertainment and horror. The rest of the cast did a creditable job.","aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":51354,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.6,"contentRating":"R","genre":["Biography","Comedy","Drama"],"datePublished":"2016-03-04","keywords":"afghanistan,journalist,war on terrorism,kabul afghanistan,karaoke","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer #1","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2132324889","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTU4NjkyODc3MF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwOTcxNTA1NzE@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTU4NjkyODc3MF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwOTcxNTA1NzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Based on the Kim Barker's memoir, Tina Fey plays a journalist reporting from war-town Afghanistan and Pakistan.","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0275486/","name":"Tina Fey","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3053338/","name":"Margot Robbie","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0293509/","name":"Martin Freeman"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0275629/","name":"Glenn Ficarra","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0720135/","name":"John Requa"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0013731/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0199243/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0023400/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1061622/","name":"Robert Carlock","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5092324/","name":"Kim Barker"],"duration":"PT1H52M"</script><metacontent=" --- Director: Glenn Ficarra, John Requa
